loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old and married with seven children, three in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Elizabeth has a food vending business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for two years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
Luzvilla is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy fish to sell.

Luzvilla successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Luzvilla's business profile to support her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ana Fe

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Ana Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Ana Fe is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Ana Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Arlyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Arlyn's business profile to support her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 28 years old and married with one child.

Agnes works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Agnes has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending and motorcycle spare parts.

Agnes aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ana Grace

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Ana Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Ana Grace is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy more items like pants, mosquito nets and bed sheets to offer for sale.

Ana Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, mosquito nets and bed sheets.

loans.name: Folole

texts.en: Folole is 40 years old and married with two children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for eight years. Folole needs a loan to buy bags of rice, flour, and sugar. Part of her loan will be spent on the renewal of her house, buying items such as iron roofing sheets, nails, bags of cement and mesh wire. She hopes to use her profits to extend and improve her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2007 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, flour, and sugar for her store, and also for the renewal of her house, buying items such as iron roofing sheets, nails, bags of cement and mesh wire

loans.name: Fiaoo

texts.en: Fiaoo is 32 years old and married with two children. She owns and operates a small store selling items such as sugar, rice, flour, snacks and frozen products. She has been doing this for five years. Fiaoo needs a loan to buy a chest freezer, sacks of rice, flour, and sugar, and snacks. She hopes to use her profits to improve and extend her business and to pay for children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a chest freezer, sacks of rice, flour, and sugar, and snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his land.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 24-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a humble house. Two years ago, Ibrahim started his own barber shop business. He loves this job and has very good experience in this field. Ibrahim wants to improve his business and expand it in the future.
Ibrahim took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new chair and a steam machine. By taking out this loan, Ibrahim will be able to improve his barber shop's conditions.
Ibrahim appears in the photo in his salon

loans.use: to buy a new chair and a steam machine

loans.name: Kuini

texts.en:
Kuini is a 37-year-old woman who has been with her partner for four years. They now have two children. 

To earn a living, Kuini runs a canteen in her community. She has four years of experience with this business. 

Kuini needs a loan to buy a chest freezer, a cooler, and plastic cups. She plans to save her profits for her children's education. Kuini has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2010.

loans.use: to buy a chest freezer, a cooler, and plastic cups.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina is a 52-year-old woman who is married with seven children. She has a small vegetable garden business and also sells pancakes in her community. Selina needs a loan to buy chemicals, gloves, sprayers for her garden business. To make pancakes, she will use part of the loan to buy flour, sugar, and cooking oil. She will use her profits to improve and extend her business. Selina joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, gloves, and sprayers and for making pancakes, flour, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, 53, is a married woman with two children who are both in school.

Cecilia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Cecilia has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Roselyn works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from candle making.  Roselyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to offer for sale.

Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to offer for sale.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 62 years old and married, with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nora has a business selling shellfish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.

Nora has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more shellfish to sell in her food stall. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more shellfish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Pricilla

texts.en:
Pricila is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and all of her children are in school. Pricila has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. 

Pricila has requested a 22,500 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like perfume, shampoo, body lotion and other personal products. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like perfume, shampoo, body lotion and other personal products.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 52 years old and married, with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for ten years and also earns an income from a vulcanizing shop.

Rizalina has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has borrowed and repaid eleven loans from NWTF before this loan. Rizalina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Veronica works hard to support her family. She sells frozen foods in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling charcoal. 

Veronica is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell to customers. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Kimberli Karola

texts.es:
Una chica carismática, sonriente y llena de mucha energía son las principales características de Kimberly. Y ser una madre no fue motivo para decirle no a los estudios, al contrario la impulso más para enseñarle a su hijo que todo se pude lograr cuando se quiere y se tiene el deseo de seguir adelante y construir un futuro próspero. Actualmente cursa su tercer año de secretariado ejecutivo.
 
Ella solicita un financiamiento por medio del programa EduCrédito de KIVA para realizar el pago de sus mensualidades de sus estudios superiores. Estimando que el crédito a solicitud le ayudara a realizar sus sueños y tener más confianza en sí misma. Sus principales a futuros son ejercer su carrera de manera profesional y lograr tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
A charismatic, smiling girl who is full of energy - these are Kimberli's main characteristics. And being a mother was no reason to say no to her studies - on the contrary, it gave her more impetus to teach her child that you can achieve everything when you want to and you have the desire to go ahead and build a prosperous future. She is currently completing the third year of her studies to be an executive secretary. 
 
She is asking for funding through Kiva's Educrédito programme in order to pay her monthly higher education fees. She thinks that the credit she's applying for will help her realize her dreams and have more confidence in herself. Her future aims are to carry out her career in a professional manner and to manage to have her own home.

loans.use: to pay her monthly higher education fees

loans.name: Ramelyn

texts.en:
Ramelyn is 31 years old, married, with one child who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ramelyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fishing net and bamboo for her fishing business.

Ramelyn has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Ramelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and bamboo for her fishing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and renovate his workplace

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Ihab

texts.en:
Ihab is a 23-year-old single man from Attel, a small village near Tulkarem City. He lives with his family in a simple house. For five years, Ihab has been working in an auto-repair workshop. It is a good business, and the only one in his area. Ihab would like to improve his business and expand it in the future. 

Ihab took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools for his auto-repair workshop. By taking this loan, Ihab will be able to improve his workshop and increase the productivity. 

Ihab appears in the photo in his auto-repair workshop.

loans.use: to buy new tools for his auto-repair workshop

loans.name: Pusi

texts.en:
Pusi is a 62-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas. She has been doing this for two years. 

Pusi needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, a machete, a crowbar and weed killer chemicals. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Pusi will use the profits from her sales to build a stable future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a machete, a crowbar and weed killer chemicals

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 21-year-old, single young man from Deir Elbalah City. He lives with his family in a humble house. One year ago, Omar started his own business which is distributing goods to the local traders, using his rickshaw. 

Omar took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw for his business. By taking this loan, Omar will be able to increase his productivity and also his income. 

Omar appears in the photo, while he was working.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for his business.

loans.name: Fahina

texts.en:
Fahina is a 41-year-old single woman with three children. She runs a canteen in her village school to earn a living. She has four years of experience with this business. 

Fahina needs a loan to buy a chest freezer, a bag of flour, bags of rice, a bag of sugar, soft drinks and a large cooler. She plans to use her profits to renew her house. Fahina has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to purchase a chest freezer, a bag of flour, bags of rice, a bag of sugar, soft drinks and a large cooler

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia is 49 years old and married with seven children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 12 years. 

Malia needs a loan to buy sprayers, weed killer chemicals, gloves and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2002. Malia will use her profits to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sprayers, weed killer chemicals, gloves and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 20 years old single man from Qabatyya, a small village near Jenin City. He lives with his mother in an old house. Jamal works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Jamal would like to improve the family living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.

Jamal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. By taking this loan, Jamal will be able to provide his family with hot water without using electricity. Jamal wants to improve the family's living conditions and maybe build a new home in the future. 

Jamal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family home

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food (palm oil, onions, Maggi cubes, salt, pepper, fish, tomatoes, etc.) in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Alpedita

texts.en: To make a living, Alpedita owns and manages a retail store offering general goods for sale in her village. With her generated revenue, she successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for the business. To improve sales, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to expand her business to earn more income and create a better life in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Amor

texts.en: Amor makes a living by providing photocopy and encoding services to people in her community. Her husband helps her in her business. She has been in this business for many years and earns a good income from this. Amor joined GDMPC recently and now is borrowing a loan to buy bond papers, ink, and folders to improve the services she offers. This is her family's main source of income. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the quality of life for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy bond papers, ink, and folders

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil is married and has five children. He operates a general store to make a living. Aside from this, he also works on their farm to earn extra income. For the past eight years, he has run his business. He earns enough to support the needs of his family and to sustain the business. He borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. He hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Ballay

texts.en:
Ballay, aged 43, is married and has three children aged 21, 20 and 17. In 1993, Ballay established her foodstuff business (selling rice, oil, flour and sugar). She began her business because she wanted to raise income to support her family. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about SLL 800,000 every month. 
Bally used the proceeds of her last loan to pay all school fees, provide learning materials for her children and help her husband provide livelihood for the family.

Ballay would like a loan of SLL 4,500,000 to buy more food stuffs for her business. In the future, she plans to give her children a quality education and to become a supplier of rice and vegetable oil. Ballay thanks you for your support and wishes you all the best.

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, oil, flour and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Julius .f.

texts.en: This is thirty-six-year-old Julius.  He is married with three children aged six, four and one. In 2011, Julius established his bar and restaurant business. He began his business because he wanted to create a source of revenue to help him provide for his family. Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, he earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 6,250,000 to buy more drinks and food items for his business. In the future, Julius plans to improve his business, his family status and support his children in getting a good quality education. He is working forward to the funding he will receive from this loan, as he requires more capital. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy drinks and food items

loans.name: Enelita

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of four children, Enelita works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing. She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

Enelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela lives and does farming in the rich area of Kisii and has been blessed with two children, both of school-going age. She has practiced farming for the past 17 years where her primary source of income is green vegetables and milk. She also has a retail business. Her biggest challenge is diseases.

Pamela chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer their loans at a low interest rate and they have fast and efficient service.

She took this loan so she can purchase a dairy cow for milk production. This will boost her income and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is 28 years old and divorced with two children, aged 6 and 4 respectively. One child is attending school.

He operates a flea market for electrical goods under Chipinge branch in Zimbabwe. He has been in this business for five years and sells his wares at the local market. He has no other source of income. He says that the main challenge to his business is inadequate stock to satisfy local demand.

Silas requested this loan through MicroKing of $400 to purchase electrical gadgets, phones and sim cards for resale.

He says that the extra income from this loan will help him boost his sales and reap more profits.

loans.use: to pay for electrical goods for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cabbage, carrots, grapes, mangoes, oranges, sapotas, potatoes, onions and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, cold water, and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, laminate sheeting and other building materials.

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer is a 25-year-old married man and a father of one child. His child is 2 years old. Sameer lives with his family in a rented house in Sana'a, Yemen. He has a diploma certificate. He is a talented and responsible professional young man. He has a high determination inside himself. Sameer didn't receive enough financial support from his family through his studies in the institute as a student because the family was faced with bad conditions in that period.

Recently, he has worked as an electrician in an electricity company. Over time, he could accumulate a good amount of money. Unfortunately, the money that he accumulated from his job is not enough to purchase a taxi. Sameer requested a loan of 500,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB in order to purchase a taxi for transportation. He says this business is good for him. Through this business, Sameer can save a lot of money that will help him provide his family with a lot of money. 

Sameer looks forward to purchasing a piece of land and building a house on it. On the other side, he wants to purchase another taxi for transportation in order to provide his family with a lot of money.

loans.use: to purchase a taxi for transportation

loans.name: Srei Thang

texts.en:
Srei Thang, age 31, is single and lives with her widower father on the island of Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Srei Thang is a weaver. She wants to launch a new mango-selling business, so that she can earn extra income to better support her standard of living. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan.
 
Srei Thang will use the capital from the loan to buy mangoes under contract from villagers at blooming season until the harvesting season comes. She needs to use pesticides to protect mangoes from insects.
 
Photo: Srei Thang with her loom.

loans.use: to buy mangoes under contract, to launch a new mango-selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition and buy educational materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees and purchase educational equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy education equipment and pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fee and purchase educational equipment for her son

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the tuition fee and buy education equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and afford daily necessities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition and purchase education equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fee and purchase more books

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her tuition fees and purchase education equipment for her daughter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more education equipment and pay the tuition fee at school

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fee and buy educational equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition and purchase education equipment

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beauty products and used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fee and buy education equipment.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn 4 Xã Trường Giang Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyệt works in agriculture farming poultry . Nguyệt has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Nguyệt faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in future.

Nguyệt is 54 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the Nhóm 01 thôn 4 xã Trường Giang solidarity group. 

In 2007, Nguyệt joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Nguyệt has successfully repaid 6 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

In the future, Nguyệt hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: Thôn 7 -Hoằng Hải Group

texts.en:
Sâm works in agriculture farming pigs. She is applying for a loan to improve her business.

Sâm is 42 years old and she is married with three children.

Sâm is the group leader of the Thôn 7 -Hoằng Hải solidarity group, which consists of seven members.

Sâm lives with three dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Sâm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Sâm has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Sâm hopes to remodel her house, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more food for pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a service crew member of gasoline station. She is happily living with her husband and two children. She is also a hog raiser in her local community. She has been involved in this kind of business for four years.

Catherine would like to take a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy hog feed and vitamins for her hogs. She knows that by providing her hogs with proper nutrition, she can make her hogs healthier upon reaching their optimum growth. Catherine is looking forward to the approval of her requested loan.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is  married with five children and lives in Clarin , Misamis Occidental with her family. She has been engaged in a charcoal sales business as a way of earning an income. For many years, she has been able to sustain her family's daily living. 

Marcelina has successfully repaid her previous loan, used for labor costs. She wants to gain more income and she is requesting a new loan to buy additional charcoal to resell. She hopes to be able to buy an additional hectare of land for her coconut production.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal to resell

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 36-year-old married man. He lives with his family and works in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Over the past five years, James was able to manage his farm to meet the market's primary demands. His farming business is still doing well and is giving enough cash flow to cover the family's day-to-day expenses. Recently, he took a new loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds in preparation for the next planting season. James expects an increase in his farm production that will enable him to expand his business and improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds in preparation for the next planting season

loans.name: Sherly Luz

texts.en:
Sherly Luz lives in Zamboanga del Sur. She earns income through providing transportation services to support the needs of her child. Sherly Luz has been doing this for four years. She solely provides for the family and she had to work for it.

Without hesitation, Sherly Luz is borrowing an amount of money to buy new tires for the tricycle used in her business. She wants to have a better living with her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her tricycle business.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 59 years old, married, and has one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Salvacion's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. Salvacion is taking out a 9,260 PHP housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Salvacion has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Enlyn

texts.en:
Enlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a candy-making business in the Philippines. Enlyn has been in this business for 10 years.

She has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, plastic wrappers, and milk.

In the future, Enlyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, plastic wrappers, and milk.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. Edna has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell.

Edna has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell fruits business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store and from selling flowers. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of fruits to sell for her buy and sell fruits business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Roeurn Soeurn's Group

texts.en:
Roeurn is 47 years old and a married mother of eight children. She is a resident from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province where cassava is one of the popular cash-crops in the area as well as for her.  She has been involved in her business for 29 years and earns a decent income to feed her family. 

This is the first loan for her and she is a leader of a group consisting of two borrowers. She is seeking a loan for 1,400,000 KHR. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay for harvesting, labor and plowing fees and to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes to increase her income and collect a better yield than in past years.

loans.use: To pay harvesting, labor and plowing fees and to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Chum Yim's Group

texts.en: Residing in Battambang province, Chum is 58 years old and a mother of six children. Rice farming and paid labor are Chum's only sources of income. She earns about 31,000 KHR per day. Chum joined VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) in order to access micro-loans. Now, her living conditions are getting better as a result of the positive impact of her past loan, which she has completely repaid. As a leader of a group consisting of four borrowers, Chum will spend her portion to buy household supplies for her family to use. She hopes to have enough materials to use in her family.

loans.use: To buy household supplies.

loans.name: Krisa Mit's Group

texts.en: Krisa, originally from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, is an elderly woman in mid-50s who struggles for a living via rice farming and a paid working job. She has been involved in her current business since she was in her 20s and it has returned her up to 31,000 KHR per day. Krisa is a new borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rice. She strongly believes that she can gain a yield that is better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Alya

texts.en:
Alya is 24 years old and single. She lives with her family in Taiz, Yemen. She has a university education, but due to high rates of the unemployment, Alya could not find a job needed to support her family. For this reason, she decided to work as a tailor. She wants to sew all kinds of clothes for the people in her area. She is very dynamic and active young woman and does very well. 

Alya wants to purchase sewing materials, but she does not have enough money to do so. She requested a loan from AMB for 100,000 YER, which she will use to purchase a sewing machine in order to work as a tailor inside her house. Alya looks forward to opening a sewing store in order to attract more of customers. She hopes to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Sokha Choub's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district, Phally, 33, has two children in total. Sophal and her husband are rice farmers who have been farming for 15 years to make a living. To add up more income, she also buying and selling cows in her village. The current business earns her about 40,000KHR per day to support her family’s need. 
Phally is just with VisionFund for this cycle and she is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthily and also hope to make more rice to better off her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farm

loans.name: Phang Chorm's Group

texts.en:
Phang is a 48-year-old father of seven children and lives in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. To make a living, Phang and his wife have been farming rice and growing cassava for almost 20 years. The current business earns him about 34,000KHR per day. 
This is the first microloan for Phang with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading his group to apply for a loan, Phang, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to earn more income so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ruku

texts.en: Ruku is 47 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 22 and 17. In 2001, she established her potato selling business. She buys potatoes from the Kalimati Bazaar, one of the famous wholesale vegetable bazaars of the Kathmandu Valley. She sells potatoes cheaply in the local market. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy potatoes for her business. In the future, Ruku plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy potatoes for her business

loans.name: Deepa

texts.en:
Deepa is 41 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 20 and 17. Many years ago, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Deepa plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fabric, jewelry, shoes, and women's purses

loans.name: Nhóm 9 Thôn 1 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Năm works in agriculture, farming poultry . She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

 Năm is 25 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the Nhóm 9 Thôn 1 Quảng Lưu Group solidarity group. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

This is  Năm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lê Thị Năm has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that  Năm faces in her business is low profit margins.

With her business profits, Năm hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and buy education equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition and buy educational equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: 07 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Thu is 41 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She has a retail business selling clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Thu faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Thu is the group leader of the 07 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.

In 2013, Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more material for her clothes stall

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en:
Maritess is 33 years old and married with three children. Meanwhile, two of her children goes to school, while her youngest child is still at infant-aged stage. 

To make a living, she offers various kinds of fruits along the national highway, and at the same time she operates her farming and hog raising business. She aspires to have a profitable and stable source of income. 

To realize this goal, she is asking for a loan of 22,000 PHP. She will use this loan in buying stock of fruits, such as watermelon, bananas and pineapples. She hopes to obtain her requested loan for the continuous growth of her business and to secure her family’s welfare.

loans.use: to buy stock of fruits, such as watermelon, pineapples and bananas, to sell.

loans.name: Eunise

texts.en:
Eunise is a 38-year-old married woman who is trying hard to provide for her family's needs, including food, health, clothing, and education. 

She is in the agriculture business of growing and selling bananas with the support of her husband. Through this, she earns well to support household expenditures. 

In order to improve her farm in the near future, she has requested a loan to purchase organic fertilizer and buy additional  banana seedlings.  In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and buy additional banana seedlings.

loans.name: Zelita

texts.en: Zelita has been operating her own general store while her husband farms to make a living. For six years, they have been able to maintain and sustain their farm. Zelita has successfully repaid a previous loan, which she used to buy farm chemicals. To improve her sales, she is requesting a new loan to buy more grocery goods to sell. She plans to save a portion of the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane has owned and managed a palay (rice) production business for many years. Her business supplements the income her husband earns from fishing and farming. The family works together in order to augment their living. 

With her income, her previous loan, used for the business, was successfully repaid. To prepare for the next planting season, Mary Jane took a new loan to purchase fertilizer and seedlings. She wants to expand her farm, to be able to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Leonilina

texts.en:
Leonilina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leonilina is 40 years old and both of her children are in school.

Leonilina has a general store business in the Philippines. Leonilina requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

Leonilina has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Leonilina would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Azela

texts.en:
Azela is 54 years old and married with eight children. With three children in school, Azela works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional merchandise for resale, such as canned goods, eggs, soap and shampoo.

Azela has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Azela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise for resale, such as canned goods, eggs, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa works hard to support her family. Maria Teresa is married and has a fish dealer business in the Philippines.

Maria Teresa requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more boxes of fish to sell.

Maria Teresa has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Maria Teresa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes fish to sell

loans.name: Cooproriz Nyiramageni G3 Group

texts.en:
Joseline is 30 years old. She is the group leader of this group. She is married to a farmer and they have three children. She will use her portion of the Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during rice production. They need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. Joseline the group leader is seated on the first row left with two children, it is a pair of twins.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
As the married mother of seven children, Mary Joy works hard to support her family.

She has an oyster culture business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. Mary Joy is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy binder and bamboo for her oyster culture business.

Mary Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy binder and bamboo for her oyster culture business.

loans.name: Leniper

texts.en:
Leniper is 23 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Leniper has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from tricycle transportation.

Leniper is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase home appliances and furniture for his house.

loans.name: Myassar

texts.en: Myassar was born in 1965. She is a widow with 5 children, 4 boys and 1 girl. Myassar has been supporting her children for 5 years using her talent in sewing, which she turned into a source of income. She is now seeking a loan to buy more fabric so that she will raise her productivity, which will lead to raising her income in order to cover her family needs.

loans.use: To buy more fabric for her sewing business

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Haya was born in in 1982. She is a widow, who was left to take care of her three daughters and her only son. 

Haya has been selling accessories and cosmetics at her house for her neighbors and friends for two years and she found this business profitable. 

Now, she is seeking a loan to add selling clothes to her business, so that she will raise her profit in order to cover her children needs and provide them with a better life.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ekome Feamo 3 Group

texts.en:
The two members of the Ekome Feamo 3 group are into very active business as individuals. They all live in Accra-Teshie, Ghana and they got to know each other as neighbors. The members of the group have small businesses buying and selling soft drinks, provisions, cutlery sets, and cooking utensils. In order to be able to get fresh supplies for cash, the group members decided to collaborate with ID Ghana and are on their fourth group loan cycle. 

Faustina is 49 years old, standing on the left in the photo, and she is a significant seller of cooking utensils and cutlery sets. She is planning to use her loan to buy cooking utensils and cutlery sets, and then sell to customers in Accra. She resells her products on a retail basis in a kiosk to a customer. 

Faustina expects to make a good monthly profit as a result of this loan and will reinvest this in her business and provide for small household needs.

loans.use: To buy cooking utensils and cutlery sets, and sell to customers in Accra.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 31 years old and a married woman, with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she sells in her community and at the market. She has been doing this for four years. 

Maria needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, a shovel, a crowbar, and a bag of fertilizer. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2009. Maria will use the profits from her sales to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy a new wheelbarrow, a shovel, a crowbar, and a bag of fertilizer.

loans.name: Anju

texts.en: Anju is 36 years-old. She is married and has three children aged 17, 12 and 7. In 1996, she established her tailoring business. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her business. In the future, Anju plans to raise the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Nitu

texts.en: Nitu is 31 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 9. In 2006, she set up her tea shop business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid eight loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent loan to buy food for her business. Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called a 'chiya pasal', these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be bought for a few cents a cup. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume. In the future, Nitu plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy food materials for her business.

loans.name: Purna

texts.en: Purna is 30 years old. She is married and has one child, aged two. In 2010, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Purna plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, each called a 'pasal', are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 52-year-old with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, spices and other fishing materials.

Gloria has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from raising pigs and selling live fish.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, spices and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Baculo

texts.en:
Baculo is 34 years old, married,  and has five children who attend school. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years. 

Baculo requested her third loan from NWTF for 9,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs. In the future, Baculo would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a seaweed culture business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more ropes, bamboo, etc. for her seaweed culture business.

She earns more income from selling seaweed and fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more ropes, bamboo, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Duterimbere Cb Group

texts.en: Duterimbere Cb means “let us grow” in English. It is led by Alphonsine who is married with four children. She owns a retail business and has ben running the business for the past six years. With her husband, they work together for the betterment of the family members. The group members work in different business types and they all have the same focus of developing their families as well as their community they are living in. With the loan, Alphonsine would like to buy rice, sugar, and cooking oil for sale. With the profits from the business, she expects to provide food for the family and make savings for the growth of the business and for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Rochie

texts.en: Rochie is 37 years old and married with five children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Rochie runs a retail gasoline business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons to sell. She has been in this business for 1 year. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lita works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling coconut wine.  

Lita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell, like canned goods, dried fish, soap, etc. for her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, like canned goods, dried fish, soap, etc.

loans.name: Norma Ruth

texts.es:
Norma tiene 36 años y está acompañada, estudió hasta 7º grado, por la pobreza en que vivia con sus padres le fue difícil prepararse mas, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en la agricultura, tiene 3 hijos que estudian 4º, 6º y 7º grado.

Norma trabaja arduamente en la agricultura al igual que su esposo, son muy unidos y luchan por salir adelante para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia, ya que no tienen otra fuente de ingreso.

Con el préstamo pretende preparar 32 tareas de tierra, comprar 10 sacos de sulfato y formula, 2 bolsas de semilla y demás fertilizantes para obtener una  buena cosecha.

El sueño de Norma es obtener buena cosecha, para generar ganancias, cancelar a tiempo el crédito para tener las puertas abiertas a  nuevos créditos y apoyar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
Norma is 36 years old, she is in a common-law relationship and she studied until grade seven. Due to the poverty in which her and her parents lived, it was difficult for them to better prepare her. Her common-law partner works in agriculture and she has three children who study in grades four, six and seven.

Norma works hard farming, just like her husband. They are very close and they fight to get ahead to meet the basic needs of their family, since they do not have another source of income.

With this loan she hopes to get 32 hectares of land ready by buying ten bags of sulfate formula, two bags of seeds as well as fertilizer to get a good harvest.

Norma's dream is to achieve a good harvest, to generate a profit, to repay the loan on time and allow the possibility of new loans to support her children so they become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy ten bags of sulfate formula, two bags of seeds as well as fertilizer to get a good harvest.

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is 19 years old. He lives with his parents and five siblings in a sector in Jordan called Baqaa. 

Osama is a university student majoring in geography. He is planning to find a job after his graduation, so that he will financially support his family after he noticed the financial crisis they are currently facing. However, he doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. Because of that, Osama has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 27-year-old married man with four children. He lives with his family in miserable conditions in Taiz city, Yemen. Imad is a very ambitious and vigorous man.  He lives in an old house which his father built for him many years ago. This house is small and old and needs repair and maintenance.

Imad wants to make it more spacious and comfortable, but he doesn't have enough money to do that. As a result, he is requesting a Youth loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase construction materials in order to make repairs and renovations on his house.

His dream for the future is to build a new house and renovate it in order to live with his children in a comfortable house. He hopes to provide his children with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials in order to make repairs and renovations on his house.

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Veronika is a 31-year-old woman who has been with her partner for 2 years. They now have 1 child. Veronika makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. 

She needs a loan to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, cooking oil, a large frying pan, yeast and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to support her family. Veronika has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, cooking oil, a large frying pan, yeast and a new oven.

loans.name: Tara

texts.en:
Tara is 45 years old.  She is married and has 2 children, ages 25 and 17.  Many years ago, Tara established her poultry farming business. Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy small chicks for her business.  

In the future, Tara plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 


In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy.  Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is 35 years old and married with three children who are in school. Mary Jane works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase rice, chips, eggs, coffee, etc.  She has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase rice, chips, eggs, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Mery Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Mery ha sentido en carne propia la despiadada sombra del desplazamiento a causa de la violencia, por esta razón se vio obligada a radicarse en Bello luego de ser desplazada de su región en San Carlos, ambos municipios de Antioquia.
Tiene 4 hijos mayores, y a sus 67 años ha atravesado por distintas dificultades para conseguir el sustento para su familia.
Inicio con venta de alimentos como frituras, aromáticas y otras bebidas de manera ambulante, pero buscando más estabilidad económica y mejores ingresos decidió con mucho esfuerzo hacerse a un kiosco en el cual puede vender alimentos preparados por ella misma como empanadas, frituras, bebidas, gaseosas, tintos y aromáticas.
Esto le ha permitido tener una calidad de vida medianamente digna, pero solicita un apoyo económico para comprar surtido de productos para su negocio y de esta manera capitalizarlo, dándole la oportunidad de aumentar sus ingresos e impactar positivamente su vida.
texts.en:
Mery has personally felt the merciless shadow of displacement due to violence, so she saw the need to move to Bello after having been displaced from her area in San Carlos, both located in Antioquia.

She has four adult children and at age 67 has faced many difficulties in supporting her family.

She began selling foods such as fruits, aromatics, and other drinks on foot, but she was looking for more financial stability and a better income, so with great effort she set up a kiosk so she could sell prepared food such as empanadas, fried foods, beverages, soft drinks, red wines, and aromatics.

This has allowed her to have a dignified quality of life, but she is asking for financial support to buy a stock of products for her business.  This will give her the opportunity to increase her income and have a positive effect on her life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Rodrigo De Jesus

texts.es:
Rodrigo es un hombre capaz de capturar los mejores momentos de la vida a través de sus fotografías. Y es que este señor de 51 años se dedica a este oficio desde hace ya varios años, acumulando gran experiencia y ofreciendo un excelente servicio a sus clientes.
El posee un estudio fotográfico en el barrio Paris, Municipio de Medellín, y desde allí aplica toda su habilidad en este campo.
El desea poder ofrecer un servicio mucho más variado y de calidad por eso requiere de dinero para comprar algunos elementos mobiliarios que sirven para recrear y hacer más dinámicas las escenas fotográficas.
Esto le permitirá aumentar su venta y por ende aumentar sus ingresos.
Es un hombre sensible y con gran capacidad para ver oportunidades.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is a man able to capture the best moments in life through photography.  This 51 year old man has been doing this for several years, gaining experience and offering excellent service to his customers.

He has a photography studio in the Paris neighborhood of Medellin and applies all his abilities to this trade.

He wants to provide a more varied and better quality service to his customers, but needs capital to buy some props to make the backgrounds more dynamic.

This will allow him to increase his sales and income.

He is a simple man with a great ability to see opportunities.

loans.use: to buy props.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan was born in 1979. She is married and a mother of 5. Her husband is a driver. Because Hanan noticed that her husband's income wasn't enough to cover her children's needs, she decided to support him by selling disposable baby diapers at her house for 1 year. 

Now Hanan is planning to expand the quantity of disposable diapers she is selling in order to serve more customers. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. Because of that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more disposable baby diapers to sell.

loans.name: Motasem

texts.en:
Motasem is a 28-year-old married man from Attel, a small village near Tulkarem City. He lives with his wife and two kids in a small house in the village. During the past year, Motasem started his own business, which is farming his land. He plants seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them to the local traders. 

He took a 1,200 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy farming tools for his business. By taking this loan, Motasem will be able to improve his farm and increase productivity. 

Motasem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy farming tools for his business.

loans.name: Serapio

texts.es:
Serapio, sigue fortaleciendo su negocio, en esta oportunidad necesita capital para comprar alimento para ganado y pago de mozos que le ayudaran a la recolecta de la cosecha.
Con la ayuda de los créditos a aumentado las cabezas de ganado que poseía, su estabilidad económica está cambiando positivamente, ya que tiene mayores ingresos por la comercialización del ganado y productos lácteos, su familia se encuentra en optimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Serapio continues to strengthen his business.  He needs capital to buy feed for his livestock and pay for workers to help gather his harvest.

The loans have helped him increase the size of his herd, improve his financial stability, and make positive changes, now that he has a better income by selling livestock and dairy products.  His family lives under better conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed and hire field hands.

loans.name: Lacasa

texts.en:
Lacasa is 19 years old and single. She works very hard to help her parents. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more household goods to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

She has been in this business for 2 years. In the future Lacasa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more household goods to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen is a 26-year-old married lady. She has two daughters and one son. She works in the daytime at a bank as an office girl. 

Recently, she started a small business, selling detergents from home. Every day she comes back home, feeds her family, does the house chores and then starts transferring the detergents into smaller quantities, or based on her customers' orders, and makes it ready to sell.

Haneen has applied for this youth loan to buy a larger quantity of detergents to increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy more detergents and bottles.

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es:
Leonel tiene 48 años, estudió solamente hasta 6º grado, debido a la pobreza en la que vivía junto a sus  padres, tiene 3 hijos y debido a la situación económica en la que viven solo les ha podido dar estudio de parvularia hasta noveno grado, trabaja en conjunto con su esposa para sostener su familia y que no les falte lo necesario.

Leonel se dedica a la agricultura, trabajo que le enseñaron sus padres, lo aprendió a la edad de 18 años,
y que le ha servido para sacar adelante a su familia.

 Leonel utilizará el préstamo para cultivar 16 tareas de maíz, comprara semilla, formula, sulfato, entre otros insumos; lo cual espera obtener buenos resultados para  cancelar su crédito a la fecha indicada y así tener las puertas abiertas para nuevos créditos que son de gran ayuda para seguir luchando y poder satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia.

El sueño de Leonel es alcanzar un mejor nivel de vida para él y su familia, ya que por la pobreza en la que viven tienen limitantes para alcanzar sus propósitos.
texts.en:
Leonel is 48 years old. He only studied up to sixth grade, because of the poverty in which he lived with his parents. He has 3 children and because of the economic situation in which they live he has only been able to support them to study from infant school through to ninth grade. He works together with his wife to support his family and ensure that don't they lack the necessities.

Leonel works in agriculture, a job taught to him by his parents. He learned at the age of 18 and it has enabled him to raise his family.

Leonel will use the loan to cultivate 16 tareas of corn (1 tarea = 69.03 sqm), to buy seed, formula, sulphate and other supplies. With this, he expects to get good results in order to pay back the loan by the date indicated and thus be eligible for new loans which are of great help to keep striving forward and to meet the basic needs of his family.

Leonel's dream is to achieve a better life for himself and his family because the poverty in which they live stops them being able to achieve their aims.

loans.use: to buy seed, formula, sulphate and other supplies

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 34 year old married woman from Attel, a small village near Tulkarm city. She lives with her husband and seven sons in a small house in the village. For the past few years, Lubna and her husband started their own business which is farming the family land. they plant seasonal fruits and vegetables and sell them to the local traders. 

Lubna requests a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to buy more seeds and seedlings for their farm. By taking this loan, Lubna will be able to improve the family farm and increase the productivity. 

Lubna appears in this photo.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 22-year-old single man from Attel, a small village near Tulkarem City. He lives with his family in a small house in the village. Ibrahim started his own business two years ago, farming his land. He plants olive trees and produces oil, which he sells to the local traders. 

Ibrahim took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more olive seedlings for his farm. By taking this loan, Ibrahim will be able to improve his farm and increase productivity. 

Ibrahim appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Agalelei

texts.en:
Agalelei is 32 years old, married, and has four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items, which she has been doing for five years. 

Agalelei requested a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy a large chest freezer, a display fridge, a hanging scale, drinks, cigarettes, snacks, a sack of potatoes, onions, and a cash register. She hopes to save her profits from her sales to secure the betterment of her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a large chest freezer, a display fridge, a hanging scale, drinks, cigarettes, snacks, a sack of potatoes, onions ,and a cash register

loans.name: Anan

texts.en:
Anan, a 28-year-old single man from Attel, a small village near Tulkarm city, lives with his family in a small house in the village. For the past five years Anan has been farming on the family land, growing vegetables and seasonal fruits in greenhouses and selling them locally.

Anan has requested a USD loan from FATEN to buy more seeds and seedlings. These purchases will enable him to improve the farm and increase productivity.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 29 years old and married with one child in school. Dinah works very hard to provide for her family.

Dinah runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Dinah has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Dinah would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lana

texts.en: Lana was born in 1986. She is married and a mother of 4 sons and daughters. Her husband is serving in the military. Lana has been supporting her husband in covering their children's needs by selling clothes and blankets to her friends and their daughters for 3 years. She is now seeking a youth loan to increase the quantity of clothes and to add cosmetics sales to her business to serve more customers and raise her profit.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and to add cosmetics to her business

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en: Sahar is 28 years old. She is married and has one daughter. Her husband works at a private company. Sahar has been supporting her husband in covering their daughter's needs by selling blankets at her house for one year. She found her project profitable and is planning to expand it. As a result, she is now seeking a youth loan to buy a larger quantity of blankets to raise her profit.

loans.use: To buy more blankets for her business

loans.name: Batool

texts.en: Batool was born in 1972. She is married and a mother of 2 girls and 1 boy. Her husband is a retired man. Batool has been making chairs, tables and other types of furniture at her house using wood and cane for 6 years, and her husband has been helping her with her business as it has become their second source of income after her husband's pension. Now she is seeking to expand her business by buying more cane, silicon, wood and other raw materials that she will need to be more productive and serve more customers. She doesn't have enough money to do so, however, and this is why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more wood, cane and other raw materials for her business

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is 28 years old and single. She operates a small canteen in the local school, which she has been doing for two years.  

Hana requested a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, soft drinks, plastic cups and plates, and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially. Hana has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to purchase a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, soft drinks, plastic cups and plates, and plastic bags

loans.name: Usha

texts.en:
Usha is 32-years-old.  She is married and has two children ages 10 and 2.  In 2010, she established her grocery store business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Usha plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Vaoau

texts.en: Vaoau is 30-years-old and married with four children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, tomatoes, cucumbers and fruits that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Vaoau needs a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, gloves, a wheelbarrow, a shovel, machete, pots, and weed killer chemicals. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Vaoau will use the profits from her sales to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, gloves, a wheelbarrow, a shovel, machete, pots, and weed killer chemicals

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en:
Kalala is 42-years-old and has been together with her partner for four years.  They have four children. 

She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, cucumbers, and tomatoes that she sells in her community and at the market. She has been doing this for four years. Kalala needs a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, a crowbar, and plastic bags. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Kalala will use the profits from her sales to make some much needed improvements in her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, a crowbar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Boresha Masiha Group

texts.en:
Loyce is a mother of three school-aged children. She is in her thirties and is married. For four years now, Loyce makes her family living by managing a shop selling spare parts of different trucks. She starts doing business from 07am to 01pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her first loan request from Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. Loyce will use this loan to replenish her shop's spare parts inventory.  She dreams of buying a car for her business. She will share this loan with her loan group "BORESHA MASIHA" which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to replenish her shop's inventory.

loans.name: Grethel Isabel

texts.es: Grethel madre soltera de dos hijos, quien antes se dedicaba a la venta de pescados por libra en un mercado de Managua, ahora instalo su negocio de pulpería en su casa de habitación que le garantiza tranquilidad y esta más de cerca al cuidado de sus hijos. Grethel solicita el crédito para invertir con productos en su negocio como granos básicos, lácteos, carne pollo, cereales, esperando así ir creciendo paulatinamente que le permita brindar a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Grethel the single mother of two children.  She used to sell fish by the pound in the Managua market, but now has a grocery store in her home.  This allows her some peace of mind and can be close by to care for her children.  Grethel is asking for a loan to buy items such as basic grains, dairy, chicken, and cereals.  She hopes to gradually grow her business and this will allow her to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials to make new greenhouses on his farm

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción, tiene 58 años de edad, junto a ella viven su esposo y dos nietos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella, sus actividades son atender una tienda en la que ofrece productos de la canasta básica, venta de pupusas y tortillas, así como también del ganado que posee obtiene la leche que utiliza para la producción de diferentes lácteos los cuales son para consumo familiar y para vender, estos conocimientos los aprendió de su esposo.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, bebidas, pan, bolsas, sal, aceite, jabón, etc., contando con un inventario bien surtido cubrirá de manera inmediata las necesidades de sus clientes y continuara generando los ingresos que tanto necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
La aspiración de Concepción es tener un chalet en el que ubicara mejor su negocio y tendrá la oportunidad de incluir otra clase de productos.
texts.en:
Concepción is 58 years old. Her husband and two economically-dependent grandchildren live with her. Her businesses are tending a shop where she offers everyday staples, selling pupusas [thick corn tortillas stuffed with meat, cheese, and beans] and tortillas, and producing various dairy products—for her family's consumption and to sell—from the milk she obtains from the cattle she owns. She learned these skills from her husband.
