She will invest the loan in the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, corn, drinks, bread, bags, salt, oil, soap, etc. By having a well-stocked inventory, she will be able to meet her customers' needs immediately and she will continue generating the income that she really needs in order to provide for her family.

Concepción's aspiration is to have a mobile stand in which she could better locate her business and have the the opportunity to include other types of products.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, corn, drinks, bread, bags, salt, oil, soap, etc.

loans.name: Aguka Cb Group

texts.en: Aguka, meaning “expand”, is a group led by Chantal. The group members have the objective of expanding their businesses to the extent of self-sustainability. Chantal sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past two years. With the loan, she will buy more potatoes and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house. All the group members have big dreams for their businesses in the future.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and rice to sell

loans.name: Noel

texts.es:
Noel, necesita capital para comprar abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas, semilla y pagara el arrendamiento del terreno en el que realiza la siembra, así continuara teniendo utilidades que le sirven para pagar su deuda y ofrecer a su familia una mejor alimentación, vestuario.
El préstamo anterior le ha facilitado aumentar la producción de maíz y jícama, tener una cosecha libre de plagas y mejores ganancias con las que respalda el buen record crediticio y el cambio positivo en las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
Noel needs capital to buy manure, fertilizer, insecticide, seeds and to pay the lease for the land he plants on. With this he will continue having goods which help him to pay his debt and to better nourish and clothe his family.

The previous loan facilitated increased corn and jicama production and a pest free harvest. With his improved earnings he supports his good credit history and the positive change in his family's circumstances.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, insecticide, seeds and to pay the lease for the land he plants on.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the costs of gathering firewood

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
José, vive solo, se dedica a la reparación de diferentes electrodomésticos como refrigeradoras, televisores, hornos microondas y otros artículos, trabaja todos los días sin un horario fijo, en este momento no representa dificultades en el negocio.
Utilizara el crédito para comprar cables, pintura, filtros, parrillas, tornillos, bombillas, diodos, fusibles entre otros repuestos necesarios para realizar muy bien su trabajo, espera brindar un buen servicio para q su negocio sea reconocido y crezca la cartera de clientes.
Aspira fortalecer más el negocio para aumentar la rentabilidad, cancelar sus deudas y apoyar económicamente a su hija.
texts.en: José lives alone. He makes a living repairing various household electronics such as refrigerators, televisions, microwave ovens, and other items. José works everyday without a fixed schedule. Currently he is not facing any difficulties with his business. José will use this loan to buy cables, paint, filters, grills, screws, lightbulbs, diodes, fuses, and other spare parts necessary to do good work. He hopes to provide good service so that his business becomes better known and his customer base grows. José aspires to strengthen his business to make it more profitable, pay off his debts, and provide financial support for his daughter.

loans.use: to buy cables, paint, filters, grills, screws, lightbulbs, diodes, fuses, and other spare parts.

loans.name: Om Osama Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om Osama. It consists of four women. They all live in traditional and simple families in Sana'a, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They applied for a loan of140,000 YER from AMB.
Mona is a 27-year-old married woman with one son. She is the leader of the group. Mona lives with her family in a rented house. She studied till elementary school, but she couldn't complete her study, because she got married when she was very young. She works as a housewife, and she is very dynamic and vigorous.  Her husband was able to accumulate a good amount of money and purchased a piece of land. Mona supported him with a lot of her money. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family and his income is not enough to cover all the expenses. Recently, Mona has plans to build a house on the land they bought. Now, the family lives in a rented house and that costs him a lot of money. As a result, Mona is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks in order to build their own house. Mona's dream in the future is building more than one floor and renovating them. She hopes to save the money which she pays for the rent. She thinks this amount of money will help her to improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Kanchi is 33 years old, married, and has two children. In 2000, she established her meat shop business. Working six days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. 

Kanchi used her most recent loan to buy chickens for her business. She requested her eighth loan from Patan BPW, which she will use to purchase meats. In the future, Kanchi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. 

In Nepal, the meat is always fresh. In small stalls along busy roads, open-air butcher shops sell chicken, goat, and water buffalo by the kilo. The stalls are piled high with product and sales are brisk. BPW's borrowers are able to purchase additional stock at better prices. This increase in purchasing volume creates greater profit margins for the borrower.

loans.use: to purchase meats for her business

loans.name: Tofu

texts.en: Tofu is a 64-year-old widow, who has six children. She has a small plantation, and she grows bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for seven months. Tofu has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, a crowbar, a shovel, fertilizer and chemicals. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. With her profits, Tofu hopes to renew her house.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies for farming bananas

loans.name: Janette

texts.en: Janette is a 20-year-old woman, who has been living together with her partner for four months. They have no children. She plans to start a small business selling chicken-meat buns. Janette needs a loan to buy a bag of flour, a frying pan, cooking oil, and a new oven. She will use her profits to help her family, financially. Janette joined SPBD in 2014, to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, a frying pan, cooking oil and a new oven

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, zinc, and others.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Edna works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling clothes. Edna is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

Edna successfully paid back her previous loan and has now requested a new loan to further build her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Elcherry

texts.en:
Elcherry is 39 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. Elcherry runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like cream, chips, bread, soft drinks, etc.

Elcherry has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from raising chicken, cultured seaweeds and fish vending.

Elcherry aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like cream, chips, bread, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Rudy Antonio

texts.es:
Rudy, se encuentra organizando lo necesario para realizar su próxima siembra y necesita capital para comprar abono, semilla, plaguicidas, fertilizantes, así asegura la eliminación de posibles plagas, aumentara su producción, tendrá una cosecha de calidad de maiz y frijol.
Gracias al financiamiento anterior la calidad del producto final fue mucho mejor, abasteció su hogar y tuvo la oportunidad de aumentar las ventas teniendo un mayor margen de ganancias, las cuales utiliza para cancelar la deuda y comprar algunos muebles para su casa.
texts.en: Rudy is organizing what he needs in order to complete his next harvest. He needs capital to buy compost, seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers so that he can be sure to avoid potential plagues, increase his production, and produce good quality corn and beans. Thanks to his previous loan, the quality of his crops was much improved. He was able to stock his home as well as increase his sales so that he had a higher profit margin. This money he used to pay off his debt and buy some furniture for his home.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, pesticides, fertilizers.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz ha sido una mujer muy diligente y laboriosa toda su vida y ha ganado gran experiencia en diferentes campos.
El último trabajo en el cual de desempeño fue en un taller de confecciones por espacio de 7 años aproximadamente.
Actualmente tiene una miscelánea cerca a su casa en Itagüí, Municipio de Antioquia donde ofrece gran diversidad de productos de papelería y en pequeña medida de uso personal.
Tiene su negocio adecuado en un local de propiedad familiar y la gran ventaja es que no le genera cobro alguno por rentas.
Ella quiere consolidar y afianzar su actividad, por esta razón solicita un aliento económico para abastecer su negocio y de esta forma capitalizarlo; básicamente serian elementos de papelería, cosméticos y elementos para regalos. Esto le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos al tener un inventario más amplio de productos.
Entre sus sueños esta la posibilidad de mantener su negocio estable y duradero.
texts.en:
Beatriz has been a diligent and hardworking woman all her life and has gained great experience in various trades.

Her most recent job was in a sewing workshop for about seven years.

She currently has a store near her home in Itagüí, in the city of Antioquia, where she offers a large variety of personal use paper products in small amounts. 

She has her business set up in her family shop, which is advantageous because she doesn’t have to pay any rent.

She wants to consolidate and tune up her business and is asking for a loan to stock her business.  Basically she will buy paper goods, cosmetics, and gift items.  This will allow her to increase her income and have a larger inventory.

Her dreams include the chance to keep her business stable and lasting.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Sebaq-Alzmn Group

texts.en:
This group is called Sebaq-Alzmn. It consists of three women. All of them live in a working-class neighborhood of the city of Aden, Yemen. The whole group took out a loan of 105,000 YER. 

Fawzia is the group's leader and she is 45 years old. She has eight children and lives with them in Aden. She decided to help her husband with the family's expenses, so she has started her own business selling mobile phone recharge cards to the people in her area. She began her business through taking a loan from Kiva. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders for the first loan. To further enlarge her business, she is asking for another loan of 50,000 YER in order to purchase a large number of mobile recharge cards to resell to her customers. Fawzia hopes to increase both her clientele and her income. She plans to begin selling perfume, accessories, and incense in order to provide her family with a lot of money.

loans.use: to purchase a large number of mobile recharge cards and resell them to her customers

loans.name: Jubran Group

texts.en:
This group is called Jubran. It consists of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB.

Iman is the leader of the group. She is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of a sole daughter who is 13 years old. She is a University graduate. Due to high rates of unemployment in the country, Iman couldn't find a job in order to improve her family with the expenses of the house. From her childhood, Iman has loved the work in trading, but there isn't anyone to afford enough support for her. As a result, Iman decided to start her own business selling accessories, cosmetics, and ready-made women clothes as a door-to-door business. She has worked in this business for three years. She earns good profits from this business and for further expanding, Iman asked for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more of ready-made women's clothes, accessories, and make up to resell to the customers for more retail.

Iman looks forward to expanding her business more through opening a clothes store in order to provide her family with a lot of money.

loans.use: to purchase more of ready-made women's clothes, accessories, and make up for resale

loans.name: Shahrazad Group

texts.en:
This group is called Shahrazad. It consists of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB.

Maryam is the leader of the group. She is a 58-year-old widowed woman who lives with nine children in a poor area in Hodeidah. She is an educated woman, but she is a very dynamic and active woman. Her husband passed away several years ago. When the condition of the family deteriorated more, Maryam decided to work selling women's clothes and accessories door-to-door.  She started this business more than five years ago. Maryam found this business to be profitable for her. She earns good profits from this business and for further expanding, Maryam asked for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more ready-made women's clothes, accessories, and makeup for more retail to resell to the customers.

Maryam looks forward to further expanding her business through purchasing all kinds of women's clothes, accessories, makeup, and perfumes and purchasing for a large amount of customers.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-made women's clothes, accessories, and makeup

loans.name: Matavai

texts.en:
Matavai is a 55-year-old, married woman; she has seven children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas, to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. Matavai has requested a loan to buy a crowbar, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, sprayers and gloves.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. With her profits, Matavai hopes to support her family and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a crowbar, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, sprayers and gloves

loans.name: Nelijean

texts.en:
Nelijean works hard to support her family. Nelijean has a cultured seaweeds  business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional rope and bamboo.

Nelijean has been in this business for 2 years now. In the future, Nelijean would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional rope and bamboo.

loans.name: Sarah Jean

texts.en:
Sarah Jean is 37 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase coffee, sugar, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Sarah Jean has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from cultured seaweeds.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, sugar, can goods, egg, etc.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a cultured seaweeds business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional rope and plastic wire for her cultured seaweeds business.

Rosita has been in this business for 1 year. She earns additional income from raising pigs and chickens. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional rope and plastic wire for her business.

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Julie Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs and cultured seaweed. Julie Ann is borrowing PHP 8,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks for her general store business, like soap, milk, noodles, and eggs.

Julie Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks, like soap, milk, noodles, and eggs.

loans.name: Ludjean

texts.en:
Ludjean is 24 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, milk, etc.

Ludjean has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from fishing. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods,eggs, soap, milk, etc.

loans.name: Babylyn

texts.en:
Babylyn is 37 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional household goods to sell like soap, spices, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

Babylyn has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns additional income from cultured seaweeds and raising livestock.

She aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell like soap, spices, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mercy works hard to support her family. She has a cultured seaweeds business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Mercy is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to  purchase materials for her business like bamboo, plastic rope, etc. 

Mercy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business like bamboo, plastic rope, etc.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rosalia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs, chickens, and cultured seaweed. Rosalia is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell through her general store business, like shampoo and groceries.

Rosalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 36 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Rosalinda has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns additional income from raising chickens. She aspires to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Helen works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Helen is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ivies Thania

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Ivies Thania works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed-selling business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Ivies Thania is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more seaweed to sell through her seaweed-selling business.

Ivies Thania has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seaweed to sell.

loans.name: Murad Thahban Group

texts.en:
This group is called Murad Thahban. It is comprised of four women. They all live in traditional and simple families, in Sana'a, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They applied for a loan of 190,000 YER from AMB.

Ebtisam is a 34-year-old, married woman, who has eight children. She is the leader of this group. Ebtisam lives with her family in their own house. She is an uneducated woman. She is very dynamic and vigorous. She works as a housewife, and her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. The family lives in a small house. This small house consists of two rooms, plus one bathroom, and one kitchen. This thing makes the family feel ashamed, particularly if any guest or visitor comes to visit them in their house. For this reason, Ebtisam applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB. The family will use the loan to purchase construction materials, in order to build two more rooms and another bathroom, which will make the house spacious.

Ebtisam hopes to open a savings account in AMB. Her dream is building the second floor and renovating it.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, in order to enlarge her family's home

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Pilar works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Pilar is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Pilar has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Silverose

texts.en:
Silverose works hard to support her family. She is married and has a cultured seaweed business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase materials for her business.

Silverose has been in this business for one year now. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business.

loans.name: Decell

texts.en:
Decell is 28 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. 

Decell works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs and milk.

Decell has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs and chicken.

She aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs and milk

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income by farming vegetables, selling prepared foods, and raising pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use this amount to buy more items to sell at her store, like canned goods, soap, eggs, and sugar.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college, in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell at her store, like canned goods, soap, and eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new air conditioner for the house.

loans.name: Om –Marwan Group

texts.en:
Om –Marwan is a group which is comprised of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 140,000 YER from AMB.

Sa'ada is the leader of the group. She is a 44-year-old married woman with seven children. Her oldest child is 28-years-old and the youngest one is 5-years-old. She is an uneducated woman, but she works hard inside her house. She works as a housewife.  Sa'ada says that her house lacks many home appliances and she can't afford them.  Inside the kitchen of her house, Sa'ada makes many kinds of drinks and sweets, but she doesn't have a refrigerator to keep all the drinks and foods in a cold condition. As a result, most of the food and drinks expire quickly. So, she puts them in the litter bin. For this reason, Sa'ada is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a refrigerator to keep foods and drinks in a cold condition in the house. 

 Sa'ada looks forward to building the second floor and renovating it. She hopes her house will be a more comfortable and spacious place.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc. for her general store business.

Raquel has been in this business for one year. Raquel earns more income from buying and selling ready-to-wear.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cans (beverages), etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase pigs in order to commercialize them

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is widowed with three children. Cristina is 54 years old and lives in Dolores Clarin, Philippines. Cristina sells snacks in the local community to earn a living and has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan to buy additional ingredients for her snack vending business. Cristina has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Cristina hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 55 years old and lives in Centro Napu Tudela, Philippines. Gloria is married with six children. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional housing materials needed for renovations. She has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, she hopes to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional housing materials needed for renovations

loans.name: Glory Joy

texts.en: Glory Joy is single with one child. Glory Joy is 31 years old and lives in Canibungan Proper, Tudela, Philippines. Glory Joy sells lechon manok (roasted chicken) to earn a living and has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan to purchase more spices and ingredients for her lechon manok business. Glory Joy has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Glory Joy hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spices and ingredients for her lechon manok business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Vilma works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more stock to sell at her store, like canned goods, eggs, coffee, and chips. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell at her store, like canned goods, eggs, and coffee

loans.name: Murika Group

texts.fr:
Murika est composé de 29 membres, Bukuru Pascal a quitté le groupe après la prise de photo.Il se trouve à  la dernière ligne,la première personne à  gauche.
M. Rose fait partie du groupe Murika  et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 43 ans  et est mariée  à Balthazar, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants.

Elle fait le commerce de bière de banane et de farine de manioc  depuis  5  ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bière de banane et de farine de manioc  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Murika Group is composed of 29 members. Bukuru Pascal left the group after the photo was taken. He is shown on the far left of the last row.

Rose is a member of the Murika Group and lives in Gitega. She is 43 years old and is married to Balthazar, a farmer. Together they have eight children. She has been a banana beer and cassava flour merchant for the past five years, and this is her first loan from Turame.

With the loan she receives from KIVA, Rose plans to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of banana beer and cassava flour that she will sell to earn more income.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of banana beer and cassava flour that she will sell to earn more income

loans.name: Muhannad

texts.en:
Muhannad was born in 1994. He is single and lives with his parents and two siblings in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat. Muhannad has been supporting his family by running his father's business. It has been running for 13 years, and is a business that is repairing and selling satellites and televisions. 

Now he is seeking a youth loan to purchase new machines so that he will raise his profit.

loans.use: To buy new machines for his shop

loans.name: Etihad

texts.en: Etihad is a 40-year-old housewife. Her husband owns a mini-market to support the family, which is their only source of income. She wants to support her husband and has applied for this loan, so that he can purchase more goods and food products for the store in order to raise their profits.

loans.use: to purchase more food products for the store.

loans.name: Norah Al- Noseri Group

texts.en:
This group is called Norah Al-Noseri. It is comprised of four women. They all live in traditional and simple families, in Sana'a, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They applied for a loan of 190,000 YER from AMB.

Asrya is a 36-year-old, married woman, and she has six children. She is the leader of the group. Asrya lives with her family in their own house. She is an uneducated woman, and she works as a housewife. She is very dynamic and vigorous. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. Their house is very small. The family couldn't afford to change this condition, and they feel ashamed, particularly if any visitor or guest comes to the house in order to visit them. Sana'a has a cold climate in most of the year's days. The house has a small bathroom. They need a water heater inside the bathroom in order to make water hot, but there isn't any place to put the water heater. Asrya decided to build a large bathroom, beside the first one. As a result, Asrya is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials, in order to build a large bathroom.

Asrya looks forward to building the second floor of the house, and renovating it in order to make her house more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials in order to build a large bathroom.

loans.name: Om Ahmmed Group

texts.en:
These are the four members of Om Ahmmed group, whose names are Hend, Maryam, Rawtha, and Ibtisam. All of them live in the city of Sana'a, Yemen. The whole group took out a loan of 155,000 YER from AMB.

Hend is the group's leader. She is a 35-year-old, married woman, with only one child. Her child is six years old. Hend lives with her husband and her child, in their own house. The house of the family consists of two floors. Unfortunately, the house doesn’t have a stairway between the first floor and the second one. They purchased an iron stairway, but it is not safe for their child. They decided to remove the iron stairway and build a different stairway, which will be safer for the child. Therefore, Hend requested a loan of 50,000 YER, which she will use in order to buy construction materials, to build a safe stairway for the house.

Hend looks forward to sending her sole child to a private school. She hopes to make a secure future for her child.

loans.use: to build a stairway for her house that will be safe for her child

loans.name: Aziz** Group

texts.en:
Aziz** is a group which is comprised of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Hana'a is the leader of the group. She is a 27-year-old married woman with three children. Her oldest child is thirteen years old and the youngest one is two years old. She studied up to elementary school, but she couldn't complete her studies. Hana'a has started her own business as a tailor inside her house, and she has been in this business for seven years. The profits from this business are not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. 

Hana'a says that her house lacks of many home appliances, and she can't afford them. Inside her  home kitchen, Hana'a puts many kinds of drinks and sweets which need to be in a cold condition. However, the climate becomes very hot in this season (summer), and unfortunately, she doesn't have a refrigerator in order to keep all the food and drinks in that condition. This negatively affects the majority of their food and drinks. As a result, most of those items expire quickly, so she has to put them in the litter bin. For this reason, Hana'a is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a refrigerator to keep the food and drinks in a cold condition in the house. 

Hana'a looks forward to furnishing all her house with new furniture. She hopes to make her house a more comfortable and spacious place.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator to keep the food and drinks cold in the house.

loans.name: Alif Group

texts.en:
Alif is a group which is comprised of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Latifa is the leader of the group. She is a 26 years old married woman. She is an educated woman with a secondary education. Latifa is an employee in a private hospital with a small salary, and her husband works in a cafeteria. They live in a rented house. Latifa says that her house lacks many home appliances, and she can't afford this. She wants to purchase a washing machine that will help with her work load. She comes back from her work in late hours daily, and she wants to take rest. But, she has a lot of work inside the house. On other side, Latifa and her husband want to furnish the house and to purchase other home appliances. Unfortunately, they don't have enough money to do that. For this reason, Latifa is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a washing machine to help her in washing the clothes and saving a lot of the time. 

Latifa looks forward to opening a saving account in AMB. She hopes to provide her family with a lot of money.

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine to help her in washing the clothes.

loans.name: Florence

texts.fr: Florence is a Cameroonian aged forty three married with three children the oldest is eighteen in high school while the youngest is seven in primary school. She has been in this business for over ten years which makes her very experience and stable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be use to increase her capital from three hundred thousands FCFA to six hundred thousand FCFA
texts.en: Florence is a Cameroonian, aged 43, and married with three children.  Her oldest child is 18 in high school while the youngest is 7 in primary school. She has been in this business for over ten years which makes her very experienced and stable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be used to increase her capital from three hundred thousand FCFA to six hundred thousand FCFA

loans.use: to buy flour to make donuts (puf puf ) and sell with fried beans and pap

loans.name: Iyadat Amer Group

texts.en:
Iyadat Amer is a group consisting of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They requested a combined loan of YER 290,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB).

Aziza is the leader of the group. She is a 49-year-old, single woman, living with her family in their own house. She has a health diploma. 

Recently, Aziza became an employee in a health office in the capital city of Sana'a. From this job, she could accumulate a decent amount of money and she started her own business by opening a clinic in order to improve the living standards of her family. The money which she receives from the clinic and the health office isn't enough to cover all the expenses of the family. 

Unfortunately, the house where she lives is very old and it needs renovation. For this reason, Aziza applied for a loan of YER 80,000 from AMB to purchase construction materials to renovate the house, such as cement and bricks.

Aziza looks forward to further expanding her business by providing her clinic with more medical equipment.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate her house, such as cement and bricks.

loans.name: Loai Nokom Group

texts.en:
This group is called Loai Nokom. It consists of four women. They all live in traditional and simple families in Sana'a, Yemen. They know one another through friendship, business, and neighborhood connections.

Baghdad is a 22-year-old single woman, living with her parents, in the capital city of Sana'a. Baghdad studied until secondary school. Because she helped her mother with the housework, Baghdad couldn't complete her studies. For this reason, she feels sad and she hopes to finish her studies. Baghdad doesn't surrender to her condition. She has a strong determination, and she strives to provide her family with a better life. For this reason, Baghdad started her own business as a dressmaker. She works inside her house. Most of the time, her mother helps her with this business. Baghdad's house lacks many appliances and most of them are very old, so she wants to purchase new appliances. Unfortunately, she doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, she requested a loan of 50,000 YER in order to purchase a new oven for her house.

Baghdad looks forward to providing her house with all home appliances.

loans.use: To purchase a new oven for her house

loans.name: Om Hail Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om Hail. It consists of four women. They all live in traditional and simple families in Sana'a, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They applied for a loan of 210,000 YER from AMB. 

Kwkab is a 46-year-old married woman with eight children. She is the leader of the group. Kwkab lives with her family in their own house. She is an uneducated woman, and she works as a housewife. She is very dynamic and vigorous. Before her husband could accumulate a good amount of money and purchase a piece of land, Kwkab supported him with a lot of her own money. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family, and his income is not enough to cover all the expenses. Kwkab and her husband built their own house on that land where they are buying. But it is still very small and it needs to expand. As a result, Kwkab is requesting a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks in order to build other rooms to make the house more comfortable and large.
 
 Kwkab's dream in the future is to build more than one floor and renovate them.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks in order to build other rooms

loans.name: Donyati Group

texts.en:
Donyati is a group which consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.
Afrah is the leader of the group. She is a 42-year-old married woman with four children. Afrah is an uneducated woman, but she is very dynamic and vigorous. She works as a housewife. Her family lives in a miserable condition and in a very old house. Afrah doesn't surrender to her condition. She has a strong determination, and she strives to provide her family with a better life. From the beginning, Afrah shares responsibility with her husband in looking after the family. Her house lacks of many appliances, and most of them are very old. She can't afford that. So she wants to purchase new appliances. Also, the family home is very old and it needs renovation. Her husband inherited this house from his grandfather. Unfortunately, the family doesn't have enough money to renovate it. This makes Afrah feels ashamed from this condition, especially when she meets visitors inside the house. Also, the house lacks furniture. For this reason, she requested a loan of 40,000 YER in order to purchase a new cupboard for the house.
Afrah looks forward to renovating her old house. She hopes to live in a comfortable house with her family.

loans.use: To purchase a new cupboard for the house.

loans.name: Santoshi 'a' Group

texts.en:
In the year 2013, five active ladies from the weaving community of a rural village called Duajhar in the Nuapada district of Odisha, India formed a Joint Liability Group named Santoshi ’A’ with the objective of expanding their existing businesses by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. 

Padmabati, a lady of 47 years standing second from left with her hand raised, is one of the members. She is very active and always cheerful. Her present family members consist of her husband and one son, 25 years old.

For the last 30 years, Padmabati has been running a clothing vending business with the help and support of her husband. This is their traditional business. Her husband purchases ready-made garments and saris from a wholesale market 200 kilometers away. He moves to different weekly markets on a bike to sell saris and garments. She earns a monthly income of 8,000 INR from her existing business. But her present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses for her family. So Padmabati wants to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business. This is her fourth loan from Mahashakti Foundation. Looking at the coming festive season, from the present loan of 48,000 INR she is planning to purchase some quality saris and fancy garments to sell. Padmabati assumes that this will definitely generate a handsome extra income. Padmabati has a dream of saving enough for the construction of a good house and the marriage of her son.

The other four members of the group are Mastana, Rambati, Santoshi and Hrudamani who are running a cold drinks wholesaling business, making and selling sweet and salty food items, and running a General Store.

loans.use: To purchase quality saris and fancy garments to sell

loans.name: Al-Jabiri Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Jabiri. It consists of five women, from Sana'a, Yemen. They are hardworking and enterprising women. They took a loan of 250,000 YER from AMB.

Fayza is a 28-year-old single woman, living with her family in their own house in Sana'a, Yemen. She is the leader of the group. Fayza studied till the elementary school. She helps her mother with house work. For this reason, she couldn't complete her study. Fayza is a very dynamic and active girl. She has a lot of house work. Her house lacks a washing machine, and she always washes the family's clothes with her hands. This work makes her very tired. Fazya couldn't afford this condition. She asked her parents to buy a washing machine for the house. Unfortunately, the their income is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. For this reason, Fayza applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to buy a washing machine to help her wash the clothes.

Fayza looks forward to renovating the house of her family and opening a saving account in AMB. Her dreams in the future are purchasing her own house and furnishing it with furniture and home appliances.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine to help her wash clothes.

loans.name: Kusmi

texts.en:
Kusmi is 54 years old and lives in Chittoldiya, Deoghar, Jharkhand. She is married and the mother of three children. Even at this age, she is very energetic. Her family has a small dairy farm, which consists of four cows and two buffaloes. She has been in this business for the last ten years. She sells milk and earns INR 400 as net profit per day.

Kusmi is requesting a loan of INR 16,000 to buy another cow and buffalo and expand her dairy farm. 

Deoghar is famous for peda (a kind of sweet made out of milk). Since Deoghar is a religious place and attracts a lot of tourists, there is always a good demand for milk production. 

Kusmi hopes to improve her business, earn more profit and save enough for her old age.

loans.use: to buy another cow and buffalo.

loans.name: Karunamayee Shg Group

texts.en:
Karunamayee Self Help Group of Sabuj Sangha helps the women in the rural areas to contribute to the income of their families and improve their living standards. The group hails from South 24 Parganas district, Madhusudanchawk village in West Bengal. The village is one of the most remote in the region and lacks basic amenities like concrete and mortar houses, electricity, etc.
 
Natural disasters like cyclone ‘Alia’ have further aggravated the situation. But the village is rich in the spirit and ideas of its women folk who want to be someone in life. 

Debirani (the lady on the left), a grandmother in her 50s, has been the leader of the group for the past 18 years. She has never defaulted on a loan. Debirani runs a ready-made clothing shop. Now she wants to make it bigger to become sustainable and leave her mark in the village. For this reason,   she is requesting a loan to stock her shop with ready-made garments.

loans.use: to buy ready-made garments

loans.name: Altankhuyag

texts.en: Altankhuyag, 41 years old, lives with his wife and children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been working as an electrician at a power plant since 2000. His wife breeds and sells domestic animals such as pigs, chickens and rabbits. The house his family lives in has been deteriorating over the years, so he is requesting a loan of 850 USD to buy vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors and fiberglass for house renovation. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then fewer pollutants will be released into the air.

loans.use: to buy vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors and fiberglass

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa is 28 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with neither of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Hasifa has been working hard to manage her spare parts business. 

To help expand her business, Hasifa has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase mirrors, tires, oil and rings, which will help her to generate greater profits and renovate her house. Hasifa hopes that in the future she will be able to expand to a wholesale business. 

Hasifa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hasifa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase mirrors, tires, oil and rings.

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en:
Maiya is 43 years old.  She is married and has 2 children aged 22 and 18.  Many years ago, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Maiya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Hakky

texts.en:
Hakky is a 27-year-old Turkish citizen. He has been working in the construction business in Lebanon since twelve years ago, to help his parents in their living. He was fifteen years old when he had to quit school during his intermediate level.

Hakky is a married man, responsible for the living of two members of his family. He is a hard worker, well known in his region. Today he is acquiring his second loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a car. This is necessary for his business development, to transport his requested tools from one project to another.

He is currently employed in a construction company, but at the same time he works for his own. He hopes that in the future he can establish his own construction company and develop his family's living.

loans.use: to buy a car to transport tools.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa est une femme humble de 36ans. Elle est la mère de deux  enfants. Elle vit  dans la ville de Lomé et  vend des chaussures.

Elle a commencé cette activité il y a 11 ans  au marché de Hedzranawoé. Elle a  vite remarqué que cette affaire lui rapportait énormément de bénéfices. Le mari d’Akossiwa est magasinier. 
Elle demande  ce prêt pour  acheter des  chaussures. Akossiwa  est heureuse  pour ce crédit qu’elle octroie. Grace à cela, elle aura plus de stocks et  pourra  augmenter ses revenus. Un de ses principaux objectifs est d’améliorer l’autosuffisance alimentaire de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a humble woman, 36 years of age, and the mother of two children. She lives in the city of Lomé and sells shoes. She started this business eleven years ago at the Hédzranawoé market. She quickly noticed that this business earned her an excellent income. Her husband works in a warehouse.

Akossiwa is requesting this loan to buy shoes. Akossiwa is happy for the loan she has been granted. Thanks to this loan, she will have more merchandise in stock and will be able to increase her income. One of her main objectives is to improve the food self-sufficiency of her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 30 years old. He runs a transport service business in Kapsabet town and is served by Vision Fund Kenya Kapsabet Branch.


He has been in this business for the last two years. From this business he gets an average profit of KES 75,000 a month.He has borrowed a loan of KES 87,000, of which he will use part to purchase spare parts and the remainder to service his taxi car.

With the anticipated profits he will repay the loan and expand his business. His dream is to give the best to his family, meeting their financial needs and giving the best education to his children, expanding his business by buying more taxi cars to meet his customers' needs as well as starting the service in other nearby towns.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the taxi

loans.name: Dezi

texts.en: Dezi lives in Kampala. She is married with five children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family member. She sells fresh fish and cassava on a retail basis at the market. She has been in this business for the last four years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings to buy fresh fish and cassava. Her business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to get a bigger stall so as to serve her customers better. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish and cassava

loans.name: Imma Casa

texts.en:
Imma Casa is married with three children. She is 34 years old and lives in Upper Centro,Tudela,Philippines.  

She sells assorted products to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 3,500 PHP doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 10,000 to restock the store with basic commodities. 

Imma Casa has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, she hopes to save more for their daily needs.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is 28 years old, married and blessed with three children. She has been in the business for 14 years and earns 14,000 KES per month.

She is requesting a loan to expand the current business by buy more house hold goods e.g. jugs,basins,buckets e.t.c by buying. With the profits she gets, she will buy more goods for sale. 

Her dreams and hopes for the future are to enlarge the business and educate all her family members.

loans.use: to buy more house hold  goods e.g. jugs,basins,buckets e.t.c

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 32-year-old lady from Kisumu region, which is located in the western part of Kenya.  She is married and supports three people in her family. She has two children who are 13 and 10 years old, respectively.

She sells new clothes, a business she has been doing for the last seven years and generates a monthly income of KES. 17,500. She has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more clothes to sell.  She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to have a wholesale shop for clothes and to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a farm where he grows maize. His farm is located in a good market area and his primary customers are both men and women. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate rain and crop pests which affect production. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer. His business goal is to be a supplier of farm products within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have an improved life. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Sally works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending. Sally is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase materials like wood, paints, bamboo, etc. for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Sally has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials like wood, paints, bamboo, etc. for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot lives in the village of Siznak in the Syunik region. He is married and he and his wife work at a large private farm producing dairy products; he is a worker there and his wife works as a milker. Both of them are also engaged in farming on their own farm, where they have piglets, chickens and a plot of land where they cultivate vegetables and fruits (potato, cucumber, carrot, tomato, greens, onion, apple, plum, fig, etc.). 

This couple does their best to provide for their two nice daughters. The elder daughter is a student at the department of jurisprudence of the paid division. Their second daughter is still school-aged. Despite of working very hard, this family still has problems when it is time to pay for their daughter's education. Ashot needs this loan in order to pay his daughter’s tuition fee for two semesters. This will be Ashot's second deal with Kiva, the first loan amount he used in order to buy fodder for his pigs and piglets, for which he is really thankful.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter’s tuition fee for two semesters

loans.name: Dariko

texts.en:
Dariko is 51 years old and married. She is from the village of Tadzrisi. She lives with her husband and school-aged daughter. Dariko and her husband work on family-owned agricultural land, growing beans and potatoes and sells the harvested products at the local market. However the income is insignificant and isn't enough for covering everyday costs. Dariko requested money and was approved under the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that enables people to start or re-start businesses. With the money, she will start a trading business with clothing. Dariko plans to purchase the clothing at a larger market located in the capital of Georgia and then sell it at an increased price to the nearby villages. 

She is a very enthusiastic and hard working person with a great desire to ensure her daughter has a good education for progressing in life. This credit will be a great support for the family. Dariko is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to generate income.

loans.use: To start a business selling clothing

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción, es una persona muy reconocida en su comunidad por su responsabilidad y su constante lucha para salir adelante junto a su familia, vive con su compañera de vida y tres hijos de 26, 23 y 15 años de edad. Se dedica a la crianza de ganado, cerdos y siembra de granos básicos, lo aprendió desde muy joven a lado de su padre, ya cuenta con 20 años de trabajar de manera independiente, en un horario de seis de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, tiene como ventajas que en los terrenos que realiza sus actividades son de su propiedad y no paga mano de obra, ya que le colaboran sus hijos.
Invertirá en la compra de concentrados e insumos agrícolas, alimentara de manera adecuada a los cerdos y el ganado para que sea más fácil su venta así como también preparara el terreno en el que realiza la siembra, existen riesgos como posibles plagas en el cultivo, cambios climáticos, enfermedades en los animales, pero espera no enfrentar ninguna.
Su sueño es continuar trabajando para mantener el negocio funcionando, subsistir junto a su familia y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
Concepción, is a well recognized person in his community for his responsibility and his constant struggle to get ahead with his family. He lives with his life partner and three children ages 26, 23 and 15. He makes a living raising cattle and pigs and also plants basic grains. He learned at a young age beside his father, but has now been working independently for 20 years on a schedule from six in the morning until four in the afternoon. Advantageously, he owns the lands where he performs his activities and does not pay for labor since his children help him. 
He will invest in the purchase of concentrated feed and agricultural inputs. He will adequately feed the pigs and cattle which will make their sale easier and will also prepare the land on which he farms. There are risks that exist such as pests in the crops, climate changes and disease in the animals, but he hopes to not face any. His dream is to continue working to keep the business working, survive with his family and pay off his debt.

loans.use: purchase condensed feed and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Al- Yasamin Al- Shoiya Group

texts.en: Al-Yasamin Al Shoiya is a loan group with four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB. Shoiya leads the group. She is a 42-year-old widow with one son who is 29 years old. She lives with him in a house they own. Shoiya is an uneducated woman and works as a housewife. After her husband passed away several years ago, her son assumed responsibility for her. Unfortunately, he is still quite young, has had only a few life experiences and is unable to cover all the expenses of the home. Shoiya says that the house lacks a refrigerator, and this is a problem because she likes to store cold drinks, sweets, vegetables and water. Especially during the very hot summer, items spoil very quickly. To prevent this from happening, she is requesting a loan for 50,000 YER from AMB to buy a refrigerator and looks forward to the opportunity this will give her to improve living conditions in her home. Her goal for the future is to furnish her home with furniture and home appliances. Her dream is to renovate her house from the inside in order to make it more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for drinks, water, and food.

loans.name: Mariami

texts.en:
Mariami is a 50-year-old widowed woman, from the village of Velistsikhe, in the Gurjaani district. She has three school-aged children and is the only person who works hard for the family's welfare. Her sons and daughter are adults and don't have their own activities. Mariami wasn't able to get much education, and that's why she can't find any stable jobs. Nowadays she works physically at various kinds of daily activities. 

The family's approximate monthly income is 200 GEL and it's hardly enough for a four member family, especially for her children's education and their increasing needs. Mariami decided to start her own business and requested a loan. Her request was approved with the start up program, that gives the chance to rural people to start or re-start businesses. She will use the requested money for purchasing stock of clothing at wholesale prices and then reselling among her friends and villagers. Also, Mariami will plant corn on the family-owned agricultural land and sell it seasonally. 

This new business initiative will be great support for this hard-working woman and her family, as Mariami will be able to tackle financial difficulties and somehow increase the living condition of her family.

loans.use: To purchase stock of clothing to resell, and to plant corn to sell.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 23-year-old single man, living with his family in Taiz, Yemen. He has a secondary school education. Due to the miserable condition of his family, Mohammed couldn't complete his study.He didn't surrender to that, but he strives to improve his condition. 

He is an enterprising and dynamic young man.  He decided to provide his family with their needs. For this reason, he started working as a worker in a grocery. Mohammed has been in this business for many years. 

The money that he receives from this business is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Inside the kitchen of his house, Mohammed's mother puts many kinds of drinks, sweets, and food in refrigerator. Because the crisis of the power in the country, the power is off in most of day's hours. This condition made the refrigerator of Mohammed's house fail at cooling. 

For this reason, the house needs a new refrigerator in order to keep the drinks and food in a good and cold condition. As a result, Mohammed is requesting a Youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a new refrigerator for the house.

Mohammed looks forward to finishing his study in the University. He hopes to get married soon.

loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator for the house.

loans.name: Al-Fathli Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Fathli. It consists of four women. They all live in traditional and simples families in Sana'a, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB. 
Sayda is a 45-year-old widow woman with eight children. She is the leader of the group. Sayda lives with her children in their own house. She is an uneducated woman. She is very dynamic and vigorous. Her husband passed away several years ago. He was the sole breadwinner of the family. Over time he was able to accumulate a good amount of money and purchase a piece of land. Sayda supported him with a lot of  her money. Many years ago, Sayda and her husband could built their own house on the land they bought. Now, the family lives in their own house, but it is very a small and most of it is not renovated from the inside. As a result, Sayda is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks in order to build their own house.
 
 Sayda's dream in the future is building more of one floor and renovating the house. She hopes to provide her children with a safe future.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials as cement, bricks in order to build their own house.

loans.name: Khaled Group

texts.en:
This group is called Khaled. It comprises of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 170.000 YER from AMB.
Fatim is a hardworking woman. She is a 48-year-old married woman and is raising four children, living with them in Sana'a, Yemen. Three years ago, Fatim started her business of selling ready-made clothes, perfumes, and incense. In the beginning, her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family. Recently, he became unable to take care of the family. So, Fatim decided to help her husband in the expenses of the family. Thanks to the experiences, she deals with her own business with ease.  She wants to purchase more ready-made clothes, perfumes, and incense to resell to her customers. She also wants to purchase a sewing machine in order to expand her business. Unfortunately, the income of this business is very low and most of what she earns goes to the expenses of the family. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. 
Fatima looks forward to expanding her business through opening a large store for selling clothes, perfumes, accessories, and cosmetics.

loans.use: To purchase more ready-made clothes, perfumes, and incense to resell to her customers

loans.name: Dallendyshe

texts.en: Dallendyshe, whose name in English means Swallows, used the previous loan to buy second-hand inventory items to resell. This time around she is seeking your help to take her husband to the eye specialist because his vision has been very bad lately. She will invest the rest of the loan in her little activity of buying and selling thrifty items.

loans.use: to take her husband to the eye specialist

loans.name: Sebastiano

texts.en: Sebastiano comes from a rural area and he is married with five children. He deals in cattle fattening. He is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy more bulls to fatten for a later sale. He sells twice a month. His hope is to see himself buy his own farm with a paddock. His challenge is that he travels long distances on foot with cattle since he has no capital to purchase many cattle for transporting in a truck. He is optimistic that with the Ugafode financial boost, his story will change.

loans.use: to buy little bulls for fattening

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.name: Deepabali Shg Group

texts.en:
Every mother wants to earn at least enough to provide her children with education and facilities, to make them able to stand on their feet and to reach the zenith of success in their life. This hope gets shattered daily because of the lack of knowledge, training and capital in rural areas of India.
 
But this group of ladies from Village Nandakumarpur in West Bengal are fighters and do not give up.

Rina (the lady in the orange sari) along with the help of her family members is cultivating paddy in the five bighas (unit of land in the common language equivalent to an acre) owned by the family and she is a role model for the group members. Still, the income she generates is insufficient to support her family. She wants to increase her cultivatable land to have higher earnings. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and pay for labor charges. 

Rina is a mother of two. Her son is studying in ninth grade and her daughter is studying in Anganwadi (pre-school). Their house is made of mud with asbestos roofing. She joined this Self Help Group named Deepabali about 14 years ago in her teens. The group, in association with Sabuj Sangha, provides requisite knowledge, training and motivation to women to be independent. 

This group seeks a loan of INR 70,000 from the generous investors to see their dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Adjo, qui est âgé de 51 ans, est une revendeuse depuis 2011. Elle  est mariée à un vétérinaire et est mère de 4 enfants .L'aîné est âgé de 32 ans et le plus jeune de 20 ans. 

Son activité est  un succès parce que la demande ne cesse d’accroître. Elle souhaite renouveler cette expérience en augmentant la quantité de céréales,  elle demande un second  prêt de 300 000 francs FCFA. À l'heure actuelle Adjo voudrait acheter  et stocker les céréales en grande quantité dans les marchés intérieurs qu'elle  gardera pendant une période, puis va les revendre à un prix plus intéressant. En prévision, Adjo voudrait élargir son commerce et a pour perspectives d’avenir l’amélioration de la santé et de l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adjo is 51 years old, and has been a retailer since 2011. She is married to a veterinarian and is the mother of four children. The eldest is 32 years old and the youngest is 20 years old. 

Adjo's business is a success, as her customer demand continues to increase. She wants to continue this experience by increasing her stock of grain. Adjo is requesting a second loan of 300,000 francs CFA. Currently, Adjo would like to buy and store large quantities of grain at indoor markets. She will keep it for a period, and then resell it at a better price. Looking forward, Adjo wants to expand her business, and for the future hopes to improve the health and education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase grain.

loans.name: Surja Maiya

texts.en:
Surja Maiya is 45 years old. She is married and has one child who is 25 years old. In 2002, she established her butcher shop business. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 7 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy chickens for her business. In the future, Surja Maiya plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In Nepal, the meat is always fresh. In small stalls along busy roads, open air butcher shops sell chicken, goat, and water buffalo by the kilo. The stalls are piled high with food that sells quickly. With the help of a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase additional stock at better prices. This increase in purchasing volume creates greater profit margins for the borrower.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase sand, cement, zinc and Iron

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay college fees for himself as he is currently pursuing further studies in college.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy  is 38 years old and lives in Dolores, Clarin, Philippines. She is single and does not have children. Juvy sells assorted products to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to restock her store with basic commodities. Juvy has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Juvy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Chona works hard to support her family.

She has a rice farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising ducks. Chona is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farm.

She successfully paid back her previous loans and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Chona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her achieve her dream of saving enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 33 years old and married, with two children.

Glenda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like chips, canned goods, shampoo, and eggs.

Glenda has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and she also earns an income from buy-and-sell fruit and raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business. Glenda aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like chips, canned goods, shampoo, and eggs.

loans.name: Diery

texts.en:
Diery is 55 years old and married, with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase household goods to sell, like soap, shampoo, canned goods, chips, and cream.

Diery has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from a boarding house rental.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase household goods to sell, like soap, shampoo, canned goods, chips, and cream.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 38-years-old and married with seven children, five of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rosie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosie has been farming rice for 19 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her vegetable business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 10 years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rolaina

texts.en:
Rolaina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling wood in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy wood to sell for her business.

Rolaina has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy wood to sell for her business

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es:
Doña Cornelia es una mujer capaz, luchadora de 53 años de edad, quien tiene aproximadamente 20 años de experiencia en cultivar y producir café la cual forma parte de una familia de tradición agricultora ya que la caficultura por generaciones ha sido el medio de ingreso más fuerte para poder cubrir las diferentes necesidades en hogar. Ella aprendió dicha actividad cortando café pues en su comunidad es la única fuente de empleo y de ingresos. A parte de dedicarse a dicha actividad también es comerciante ya que vende en su comunidad verduras como pataste, cebollas, remolachas y otras que ella misma cosecha. Su propiedad es producto del esfuerzo de su trabajo ya que no es herencia como en otros casos en compañía de su esposo por varios años. De su matrimonio tiene tres hijos pero solo dos viven con ella pues el mayor de todos ya está casado y en hogar a parte quienes contribuyen en los diferentes oficios en el campo y demás para que sus cultivos se mantengan en un excelente estado.
