Sus metas para este nuevo año es hacer sus cultivos de café en un 100% productores pudiendo obtener de ellos una excelente cosecha para ir poco a poco creciendo y generando mayores ingresos cada año ya que la temporada pasada sus cultivos fueron afectados por la roya destruyendo 2 manzanas cultivadas del tipo de café caturra y que gracias a este apoyo financiero solicitado ella podrá prevenir que esto se dé nuevamente. Sus sueños como madre para con sus hijos apoyarles en sus metas, proyectos y demás que hagan de ellos buenas personas y trabajadores. Por lo que ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL financiamiento con el cual quiere comprar insumos agrícolas para poder asistir sus cultivos de café y así al final de esta temporada lograr obtener un excelente resultado.
texts.en:
Cornelia is a capable and hardworking 53-year-old who has about 20 years of experience in growing and producing coffee. She is part of a family tradition of coffee farming which has been the family's strongest form of income for generations. It covers the different needs in their home. She learned the work, such as picking coffee, in her community as her only source of employment and income. Apart from working in this activity, she is also a merchant who sells vegetables in her community. She sells chayote, onions, beets, and other crops that she grows herself. 
Her property is the result of her effort and work because she did not inherit it. She has been with her husband for years. From her marriage, she has three children but only two live with her because the oldest son is already married and in his own home although he does contribute in different capacities in the field to help crops maintain their excellent condition. 
Her goals for this new year are to increase her coffee harvest by 100%. They want to have an excellent crop by slowly growing and generating more income every year. Last season, the harvest was affected by a blight destroying two fields [of approximately 3.5 acres] in which they were growing the Caturra variety of coffee. Thanks to this financial support that she is requesting, she can prevent this from happening again. Her dreams as a mother are to support her children's goals, projects, and helping them becoming good people and hard workers. she has asked for the loan from COMIXMUL with which she will buy agricultural inputs to maintain her coffee crops so that at the end of the season she will obtain excellent results.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay day laborers to maintain her coffee harvest

loans.name: Amahoriwacu Group

texts.fr:
S. Caritas fait partie du groupe Amahoriwacu  et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 42 ans  et est mariée  à Pierre, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 6 à 20 ans, dont 4 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce  de bananes  depuis  20  ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
S. Caritas is a member of the Amahoriwacu Group and lives in Gitega. She is 42 years old and is married to Pierre, a merchant. Together they have five children between the ages of six and 20, four of whom attend school. 

S. Caritas has been selling bananas for the past 20 years. She is on her fifth loan with Turame. With the loan she receives through KIVA, S. Caritas plans to increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of bananas that she will sell to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of bananas that she will sell to earn more income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase timber to expand her business.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is a 34 year old woman and has been with her partner for six years. They have one child. 

She makes and sells donuts, meat pie, and ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Telesia needs a loan to buy cooking oil, a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, icing sugar, yeast, and containers. 

She plans to save her profits for her child's education. Telesia has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, icing sugar, yeast, and containers

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhjargal, 48 years old, lives with his wife in Kherlen, the easternmost town in Mongolia. He has been working as a machinist at a power plant since 1980, while his wife grows and sells vegetables on their land. They have four children, all of whom live in Ulaanbaatar. 

Enkhjargal is requesting a loan of 1500000 MNT to buy wooden arches, fiberglass and frames to build a greenhouse. They are in urgent need of of a greenhouse because a significant amount of family income depends on vegetable sales. Increasing the duration of the vegetable growing season will increase their harvesting output.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Sulesa

texts.en:
Sulesa is a 32-year-old, married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and she grows cabbage, beans, and cucumbers to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Sulesa has requested a loan to buy bush knives, chemicals, weed sprayer, filings, and an axe. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since April 2014. With her profits, Sulesa hopes to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed sprayer, filings, and an axe.

loans.name: Sulisa

texts.en: Sulisa is a 43 year old married woman with 13 children. She has a small business, a taxi service. Sulisa needs a loan to buy seat covers, wheel caps, shocks, new tires, oil, brake pads and a vehicle license. She will use her profits to help her family living and improve her business. Sulisa joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy seat covers, wheel caps, shocks, new tires, oil, brake pads and a vehicle license

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 56 years old and lives in Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children who are now adult and school age. 
Meriam has a little store and sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for a year now. Meriam earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month from her business. She has requested a loan to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retail. 
Meriam has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Meriam a hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and other products for retail sale.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 63 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children now in their adult age. 

Patricia has been engaged in a fish vending activity for two years already and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing an additional 50 kilos of fish for resale. 

Patricia has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, she hopes to expand her fish vending activity to other nearby towns.

loans.use: To purchase 50 kilos of fish for resale

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en:
Maiya is 40 years old .  She is married and has three children aged 21, 18, and 10.   Many years ago, she established  her grocery store business.  

Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Maiya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

 In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 57 years old and lives in Map-an, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children who are now adults. 
Gloria has been raising hogs for 20 years and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase an additional 8 sacks of feed. Gloria has been a member of PMPC for almost 9 years. In the future, Gloria hopes to expand her hog-raising business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional 8 sacks of feed.

loans.name: Junelo

texts.en:
Junelo is single. Junelo is 25-years-old and lives in Poblacion, Salug, Zamboanga del Norte.

Junelo sells office and school supplies to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, he earns 5,000 doing this type of business. He has requested a loan for 49,900 PHP to purchase more products.

Junelo is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Junelo hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more office and school supplies to sell like ballpens, bond paper, fasteners, pencils, and other supplies

loans.name: Miguel De Los Santos

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel de los Santos labora como Guarda de seguridad en una Empresa de proteccion de seguridad a los pozo de agua potable  del municipio donde trabaja por turnos de 24 horas para llevar el alimento a su familia.

El Sr. Miguel solicita este credito para mejorar su casa de habitacion y asi brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, ya que se prepara la entrada de la temporada de invierno.
texts.en: Miguel de los Santos works as a security guard for a security company, at the drinking water well in his town, where he works 24-hour shifts to feed his family. He is seeking a this loan in order to make improvements to his home and so give his family a better quality of life, particularly to get ready for the arrival of winter.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and reinforcing steel.

loans.name: Lou

texts.en:
Lou is 48-years-old and lives in Dela Paz, Pananon, Misamis Occidental. He is separated with four children, who are now adults.
 
Lou has been engaged in hog fattening activities for two years already. At the present time, he also earns income from his boarding house business. He earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month from doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to be used to purchase an additional 5 piglets and 10 sacks of booster and grower feed. Lou has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Lou hopes to expand his hog fattening business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional five piglets and ten sacks of booster and grower feed

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda is 35 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with two children.

Daylinda works in the fish industry and sells/catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for one year. She has requested a loan for additional capital to purchase a new fishing boat machine.

Daylinda has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Daylinda hopes to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase a new fishing boat machine

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 51 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 4 children who are now all school aged. 
Thelma has been engaged in operating a little sari-sari store for 2 years and earns approximately PHP 3,000.00 each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retail. Thelma has been a member of PMPC for 9 years. In the future, Thelma hopes that all her children will finish college from the fruits of her labor and with the help of PMPC.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retail

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky is 34 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with 1 child who is school aged. 
Ricky is presently working as a laborer in coconut harvesting. Ricky earns approximately PHP 3,000.00 each month from doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to be used to purchase a parcel of cocoland. Ricky has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Ricky hopes to acquire additional parcels of cocoland.

loans.use: To purchase a parcel of cocoland

loans.name: Whylyn

texts.en:
Whylyn is married with 2 children. Whylyn is 33 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
Whylyn sells bananacue (a sweet friend plaintain snack) to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 doing this type of small business. She has requested a loan for 30,000 for additional capital towards her business. She wants to purchase more raw ingredients for bananacue vending.
Whylyn has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Whylyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for bananacue (a sweet fried plantain snack) vending

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married with 3 children. She is 26 years old and lives in Salvador, Gutalac, Zamboanga del Norte.
Emma operates her own bakery to earn a living and has had this business for 1 year. Each month, she earns 10,000 doing this type of business. She has requested a loan for additional capital for her bakery business.She wants to purchase baking equipment and bags of flour.
Emma has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Emma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase baking equipment and bags of flour

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en:
Claudio is 60-years-old and lives in Salimpono, Pananon, Misamis Occidental. He is single with no dependents.
 
Claudio has a passion for cooking and presently works as a cook in one of the eateries in the town of Jimenez. He earns approximately PHP 3,600 each month from doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs. Claudio has been a member of PMPC for almost 10 years. In the future, Claudio hopes to manage his own eatery business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genera, a 58-year-old widowed mother of eight, lives in Silangit, Tangub City, Philippines. A farmer for 30 years, she  grows root crops and corn to earn a living. 

Genara, who has been a member of PMPC for five years, has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs and  fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to own another farm to cultivate.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is married, with four children. She is 41 years old and lives in Silangit, Tangub City Philippines. Anecita is a farmer and she grows corn and fruit-bearing trees to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. 

She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. 

Anecita has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for five years. In the future, Anecita hopes to buy other farmland to extend her production some day.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia prepares ice cream and her husband sells it in town. For many years they have been selling ice cream because it helps a lot to support their needs. She is thankful to GDMPC, which gives them a chance to have the capital to continue their small business.

With her generated income, her previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid.  She wants to improve the general living condition of the family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to prepare ice cream to sell

loans.name: Nayme

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nayme works hard to support her family.

She has a bamboo weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and a general store. Nayme is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo to weave.

She successfully paid back her previous loans and now she requested an additional loan to further expand her business.

Nayme has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo to weave.

loans.name: Rainer John

texts.en:
Rainer John is a hardworking 20-year-old man. He is studying in a university taking the Basic Seaman Training Course (BSTC).

Rainer John is someone who is very dedicated to his studies and to the love of his family. His father passed away and his mother is a businesswoman. He works at various jobs to move forward. 

He is requesting this loan to pay his school tuition fees. His goal is to continue studying to prepare for a better future. He wants to find a job related to his course of study in the near future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling spices and vegetables in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Melly has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Melly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza, requiere un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de maíz por mayoreo, pues al comprar de esta manera el precio es mucho menor que hacerlo al menudeo, así el margen de ganancias aumenta y le permite evitar futuros retrasos en el pago de las cuotas también seguir mejorando el ambiente familiar.
Con la inversión anterior tuvo todo lo necesario para elaborar la venta de tortillas y antojitos ha logrado  mantenerse trabajando sin problemas, sus clientes han aumentado, la familia tiene un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Maritza requires a new loan to invest in the purchase of maize in bulk because when buying wholesale she saves so much more money than when she has to pay retail price. The profit margin increases and allows her to avoid further delays in the payment of her loan. She can also continue improve her family's situation.
With the above investment, she has everything she needs to make and sell tortillas and snacks. She has managed to keep working steadily and her customers have increased. Her family has a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale maize to make tortillas

loans.name: Ma. Sheena

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ma. Sheena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling beauty products. Ma. Sheena is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional clothing to sell for her buy and sell in her clothing shop.

Ma. Sheena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice grains to sell for her business.

Erma has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice grains to sell for her business.

loans.name: Enkhtaivan

texts.en:
Enkhtaivan, 47 years old, lives with his wife in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has been working at a power plant, coordinating the coal usage. His wife is a janitor and works at the supply unit of a power plant. Their children live on their own. 

He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, planks, and fiberglass for house renovation. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years, due to heavy snowfall and strong storms. After renovation, he and his wife will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is used and then fewer pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients like sugar, milk, and eggs for her food vending business.

Melinda has been in this business for 2 years. Melinda earns additional income from fishing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients like sugar, milk, and eggs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old and married with eight children, three of whom are still in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like spices, egg, noodles, soap, and milk.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid back 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from selling vegetables and raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell like spices, eggs, noodles, milk, and soap.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Soledad works hard to support her family. Soledad lives in the Philippines.

She she buys spices and vegetables for resale and also earns additional income from farming citrus fruits. Soledad is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of spices to sell for her buy and sell spices and vegetables business.

Soledad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of spices to sell.

loans.name: Lini

texts.en:
Lini is a 36-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taamu, taro, yams, and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

She has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, a weed-sprayer, filings, and an axe. Lini has been a member of SBPD since April this year 2014 to gain access to financial services. With her profits, Lini hopes to save for unexpected emergencies and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, a weed-sprayer, filings, and an axe

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia is 73 years old, from San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta. She has been widowed for so many years now, but this does not keep her spirit from surviving, especially in raising her children. She has a store where she gets her income. This has been going for 30 years already.

Despite the odds, Rogelia maintains being a member in good standing with the Cooperative. She took several loans and has no records of default. Now she is asking for a loan to purchase basic commodities to sell. Rogelia hopes to continually provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase basic commodities to sell

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 31 years old, from Oroquieta CIty. She is married and manages her own store for a living. She is a hardworking micro-entrepreneur who also maintains her membership with PMPC. 

She took several loans already but has no records of default. Now, in need of capital, she approached PMPC to restock her store with basic commodities. 

In the future, Arlyn hopes to become successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel es soltera pero tiene un hijo, ella vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento Isabel paga un alquiler Isabel se dedica a la venta de discos compactos de música y peliculas en DVD y Blue Ray. Isabel necesita un credito para incrementar su mercaderia y de esa manera elevar sus ingresos Isabel es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Isabel is single and has one child. She lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house, where she pays rent. She earns her living selling music CDs and films on DVD and Blu-ray. She requires a loan in order to expand her stock of merchandise, and so increase her income. Isabel is the only source of income in her household, which is why she needs this help.

loans.use: to increase her stock of merchandise (music CDs and films on DVD and Blu-ray).

loans.name: Liway

texts.en:
Liway works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Liway requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of bananas to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Altantsetseg, 43 years old, lives with her husband and four daughters in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. She has been working at a sausage factory as an ingredient developer since 2011. Her husband also works as an assistant at the same factory as she works. Their two elder daughters study at university. 

She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy building materials, such as shingles, bricks, cement and fiberglass. Since 2012, she has been collecting leftover bricks from a construction site, and last year she began building her house. She is planning to complete her house before winter, and for this cause she is asking for a loan. 

If she can move to her house before winter, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place, as well as save money on coal. Reduced coal means fewer pollutants in the air.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Javier Alexander

texts.es:
Javier, es un joven soltero, vive con sus padres, aprendió de su padre lo relacionado con la crianza de ganado, cerdos y siembra de granos básicos, su deseo de independizarse y apoyar a su familia, lo motivo a trabajar por su cuenta, ya tiene 4 años con su negocio, sus ventajas son que las  propiedades son patrimonio familiar y no tiene otros compromisos económicos.
El crédito lo utilizara para comprar cerdos, concentrado (para ganado y cerdos) e insumos agrícolas, de esta forma sus actividades económicas se verán fortalecidas y le darán mayores ganancias con las que cancelara su deuda y apoyara a sus padres.
Su sueño es continuar trabajando para lograr construir su propia casa así en un futuro formar una familia.
texts.en:
Javier is single and lives with his parents. He learned how to raise pigs and cows, as well as how to raise crops, from his father.  He wishes to become independent and support his family.  This is his motivation for working on his own. He has already had his business for four years.  It is to his advantage that his family owns the land he works on, and he does not have other financial obligations.

He will use the loan to purchase pigs, feed for cows and pigs, and agricultural supplies.  This will strengthen his business and lead to higher earnings, which he will use to pay off his debt and support his parents.

His dream is to keep working so that he can build his own home and start his own family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, feed for cows and pigs, and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Al- Nama** Group

texts.en:
Al- Nama** is a group which is comprised of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB.

Fwzya is the leader of the group. She is a 46-year-old married woman with seven children. Her oldest child is 30 years old and the youngest one is 7 years old. She studied up to elementary school, but she couldn't complete her studies. Fwzya's husband is employed as a soldier in the army. Three of her children are also employed as soldiers in the army. The family is very dynamic and works hard in order to improve their living standards. The salaries which they receive from those jobs are not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. 

Fwzya says that her house lacks a refrigerator, and she can't afford this. In her kitchen, Fwzya keeps many kinds of drinks, foods, sweets and vegetables which need to be in a cold condition. Unfortunately, the climate these days is very hot, and without refrigerator in order to keep all the food and drinks in a cold condition, most of the food and drinks expire quickly. Because of this she has to put them in the litter bin. For this reason, Fwzya is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a refrigerator for the house. 

Fwzya looks forward to improving the condition of her family. She hopes to open a savings account with AMB. Her dream in the future is to furnish her house with new furniture and home appliances.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for the house.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
This hardworking micro-entrepreneur is named Natividad. At the age of 73, she is a hands-on businesswoman at her store at Talairon, Oroquieta. 

Every month, she earns a promising income of PHP 9,000. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase inventory of eggs to sell.
 
Natividad hopes to pass her business to her children.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 34 years old, married and blessed with one child. She is engaged in selling different motor parts and accessories within their community. She aspires to improve this business and make it profitable in order to help her husband in sustaining their necessities and save some for future emergencies. 

Having inadequate capital, she wants to avail a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy more stock of motor parts and accessories to sell. She is hoping that she will obtain her loan request to be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of motor parts and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Zarniyar

texts.en:
Zarniyar is 40 years old refugee. She is married and has a daughter and a son. Her husband is a laborer. The family lives in IDP settlement for a long time. Thought her husband earns money the main source of income is gardening. Zarniyar has been  raising and selling seasonal fruits (apples, cherries, peaches, pears)for 12 years and has good skills in this area. Her mionthly income is 200 AZN.

Fresh fruits are in high demand because Azerbaijan people like to eat them and use them to prepare fresh juice, jam, fruit pies and etc. Zarniyar sells fruits at local bazaar and local people like to attend her grocery because fruits there are always fresh and tasty. 

Zarniyar’s income from gardening doesn’t cover family’s demands. She applied for 1500AZN in order to supply new sorts of fruits and buy quality garden tools.

loans.use: to supply new sorts of fruits and buy quality garden tools

loans.name: Marina De Jesus

texts.es:
Marina, vive junto a su esposo, dos hijos y una nuera, como una manera de apoyar en las necesidades de su familia, inicio su propio negocio de venta de tostacas y totopostes, trabaja todos los días sin horario fijo, no representa dificultades en el negocio.
Compra maíz, aceite, dulce de panela, manteca, bolsas, leña entre otros materiales necesarios para elaborar la venta, espera aumentar la producción para cubrir los diferentes pedidos, atraer nuevos clientes, tener mayores ventas e ingresos con los que cancelara su deuda y aportara en los gastos familiares.
Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande, aumentar la rentabilidad que tanto necesita para apoyar a sus hijos que culminen una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Marina lives with her husband, two children and a daughter-in-law. As a way of supporting her family, she started her own business selling tostacas and  totopostes (Honduran pastry snacks). She works every day with no fixed hours, and doesn't have any difficulties in her business. 

She buys corn, cooking oil, un-refined sugar, lard, bags, firewood and other necessary supplies for making her food. She hopes to increase production so that she can cover various orders, attract new customers, have greater sales and revenues with which she will pay off her debt and contribute to the family expenses.

Her dream is to have a larger business and to increase profitability, which she so much needs in order to support her children in completing a university education.

loans.use: To buy corn, cooking oil, unrefined sugar, lard, bags, firewood

loans.name: Rosadek Group

texts.en:
This group consists of eight hardworking and successful business people, who have businesses and provide different services: seamstress, mechanic, shoes, and groceries.

The featured borrower is Simpson who is 54 years old, has a wife, and is the father of a 10-year-old. He is the owner of a mechanic shop where he also sells car spare parts.  He is asking for a loan to buy more car parts to use them to repair customers' vehicles. He has been making a good profit in this business since he buys spare parts at wholesale price and sells them to the customers at the retail price, plus the service charges for labor.

Together the other members including the female will need a total amount of 6,600 GHS to be able to serve their customers better. They have been together for many years, and this is their fifth loan cycle. They will hold one another responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts at wholesale price and sell to customers at the retail price, plus the service charge for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his business by purchasing more livestock

loans.name: Domingo Armando

texts.es: Domingo de 33 años de edad posee desde hace 15 años una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos y los precios accesibles,  con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logar solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos, Domingo esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor como: sopas, granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, café, azúcar, detergentes, etc. y así obtener mejores ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Domingo, age 33, has had a store at his house for 15 years.  He has a lot of customers because of the variety of products and the affordable prices.  With what he gets from his sales, he manages to pay some of the household expenses.  He lives in his own house with his wife and their children.

Domingo is requesting a loan to buy more products wholesale.  He will buy things like soups, basic grains, candy, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, and detergents, etc.  This way he will get better income in order to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soups, basic grains, candy, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, and detergents, etc.

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.en: Nathalie is a 38-year-old Cameroonian who is married with three children: the oldest is thirteen and in secondary school while the youngest is seven and in primary school. She has been in this business for over four years, which makes her very experienced and stable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be used to increase her turnover from 900 000 FCFA to 1000 000 FCFA.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs (okro, cabage, tomatoes, plantains, etc.) in large quantity to resell in smaller quantities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Kenny

texts.en:
Kenny, 50, comes from Nyimba District, Zambia. He is asking for a loan to obtain a water pump that will help him irrigate and expand his vegetable crops.

Like many small farmers in Zambia, Kenny currently uses buckets to draw water from a nearby river to irrigate his vegetable garden. This is an extremely tiring task, especially now that the dry season has begun. Last season, Kenny managed to grow fresh maize, spinach and lettuce that he sold in nearby towns. He is hoping that with a water pump he can grow more high value crops this season. 

Rent to Own has worked with Kenny to create a business plan for this year’s gardening season and will deliver a water pump directly to his farm. Rent to Own will also provide training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and will provide on-going support until he has completed his loan.

This year Kenny intends to grow cabbage, tomatoes, green beans and even carrots. He hopes to use the profits to support his four children who are currently attending school.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Ratnadeep Shg Group

texts.en:
The group is led by Saraswati (the lady in the yellow sari), a woman in her 30s who is living with her mother and brother after her divorce. The group in the name of Ratnadeep Self Help Group (SHG) is associated with the local NGO Sabuj Sangha, which works in the field of women's empowerment by providing skills to earn a livelihood. For Saraswati, various adverse situations in life have made her really tough, but she is caring, helpful and loving.

The women in the group are natives of the village of Narendrapur in West Bengal, which has a lot of ponds, good agricultural land and access to nearby markets.
 
She has always repaid her previous nine loans on time and has been a part of the group since 2001. She wants a loan to buy manure, raw materials, fish food, etc for her fish farm.

Ekadashi wants to set up a mini rice mill, Shephali dreams of running a medical shop and Rinku want to fill up bowls by cultivating paddy.  These women hope to excel in their chosen areas.

loans.use: to buy manure, raw materials and fish food

loans.name: Nibedita Shg Group

texts.en:
Alokrani (the lady standing in the middle of the photo) belongs to Nandkumarpur village in the South 24 Parganas district of West Bengal, India. Her family consists of her husband, a son and a daughter. Her daughter has completed M.A while her son has completed high school. Both of them help Alokrani in paddy cultivation. Their house is made of mud. The income is not sufficient and with the daunting responsibilities, she is finding it hard to run the household. 

Alokrani is the leader of Nibedita SHG formed with the help of the local NGO Sabuj Sangha. She has been an active participant of the group. The members of the group share ideas and motivate each other. As a group, they are usually involved in different jobs to reduce the risk of business failure. Sabuj Sangh is constantly trying to raise the standard of living for rural people.

Alokrani needs a loan for paddy cultivation. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and Boro seeds (a type of paddy). She expects to reap a profit of INR 50,000 per year. With her finances in place, she can expect to bring stability to her family.

The other members in the group request loans for paddy seed cultivation and to run a stationery shop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and Boro (paddy) seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: A loan of $3,000 helped Zainab to pay for her daughter's education.

loans.name: Indira Shg Group

texts.en:
A SHG or self-help group helps in training, mutual sharing of ideas, motivation and mutual financial help. As a group, the members are usually involved in different jobs to reduce the risk of business failure. Many SHG in India have been successful and have been able to raise the standard of living of their members.

Kakoli (the lady in the violet sari) is her 40’s and hails from Nandakumarpur village in South 24 Praganas in West Bengal. She is a part of Indira SHG and is the group leader of the SHG. The area is located in the Sundarban area, which receives good rainfall and is dotted with ponds and other similar water sources. 
 
She has been planning to start a fish culture business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy manure, raw materials and food for the fish. She hopes to earn a profit of Rs 55,000 per year, based on her prior experience in the business. Kakoli has a family of five and all three of her children are studying. The family doesn't possess considerable land for paddy cultivation and the income is not sufficient to run the family. Kakoli hopes that with the fish business, she will improve their living standards.

Other members in the group have a diverse set of businesses including a tea-betel shop and paddy seed cultivation.
 
The fish culture business in this part of India is quite prevalent and the only impediment is that of financial constraints. The SHG helps to mitigate the risk of default as the SHG is responsible for paying as a whole, not as individuals. These women hope to bring stability in their life and become successful rural entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy manure, raw materials and food for fish

loans.name: Luaipou

texts.en: Luaipou is a 31-year-old single woman with no children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, banana and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Luaipou has requested a loan to buy bush knives, a weed sprayer, filings and an axe. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. With her profits, Luaipou hopes to improve her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, a weed sprayer, chemicals, filings and an axe.

loans.name: Paquito

texts.en:
Paquito is a responsible man who never neglects the needs of his family. From providing education for his children to living comfortably with a neat house to live. At the age of 69, he still works hard doing a buy-and-sell business selling variety of items. 

Recently, he is in need of financial assistance to do house repairs. He wants to purchase housing materials, such as bags of cement, nails, and plywood.  Paquito makes it a point to keep his obligations to be paid in a timely manner. The loan will be repaid out from his buy-and-sell business.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials, such as bags of cement, nails, and plywood, to do house repairs.

loans.name: Donato

texts.en: Donato is a father of three. He is a farmer. His family lives at Baggao in the province of Cagayan Valley. He raises crops, specifically planting and harvesting rice to sell. His wife is a dressmaker and sells bags, clothes and perfumes.  To improve his farming business, he is asking additional capital of PHP 35,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. It will help improve the growth of his crops so that he will harvest it profitably some day. He hopes to keep developing his farming practices too.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy different types of fishing nets.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is a businesswoman who sells a variety of items. She is 68 years old, married and a member in good standing with PMPC. Recently, she approached PMPC for a loan. She wants to purchase hollow blocks and bags of cement for her house renovation. She wishes to live comfortably in a  renovated house. The loan will be repaid in several months but Lilia promises to pay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to purchase hollow blocks and bags of cement

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, requiere un nuevo crédito que le permita comprar maíz, gas propano, chicharrón, quesillo, aderezos, bolsas y harina para elaborar la venta de pupusas, su demanda ha crecido por que ya cuenta con un local en el mercado de la zona, con esta inversión su negocio seguirá siendo estable y aumentara sus ingresos.
El capital anterior le permitióa María tener la materia prima para mantenerse trabajando, su situación económica ha tenido un cambio positivo ya que ha logrado cancelar su deuda y mejorar las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
María needs a new loan that will allow her to buy corn, propane gas, ‘chicharrón’ [fried pork rind], soft cheese, dressings, bags, and flour to prepare for her ‘pupusa’ [stuffed tortillas] sales.  Her demand has grown because she now has a place at the market in the area.  With this investment her business will continue being stable and her income will increase.

The previous loan allowed María to have the raw material to keep working.  Her financial situation has had a positive change.  She has managed to pay her debt and improve her family circumstances.

loans.use: to buy corn, propane gas, ‘chicharrón’ [fried pork rind], soft cheese, dressings, bags, and flour.

loans.name: Josue Marino

texts.es:
El joven Josué es una persona muy educado y con buenos principios y una excelente persona que se dedica a la agricultura como profesión, es una actividad que heredó de su padre quien le enseño y le inculco por el buen camino para ser persona de bien en la vida. Él tiene 24 años de edad.

Él vivió con sus padre quien le ayudaba en las tareas agrícolas todos los idas por las mañanas, ya que por las tardes asistía a la escuela donde curso hasta el 7° grado, motivo por el cual ya no continuo sus estudios fue porque su padre una persona ya de la tercera edad comenzó a ponerse mal de salud hasta el punto que falleció y fue él quien desde ese momento tomo las riendas de su hogar en el cual le tocaba trabajar muy fuerte para llevar el sustento diario a su familia que está compuesta por su madre y sus 3 hermanas.

 Desde entonces el joven se dedica a los trabajos de agricultura al manejo de granja de gallinas ponedoras y al destazo de cerdos, actividad a la cual se suman su madre y sus hermanas, las que en la actualidad se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.


El joven tiene una experiencia de realizar el trabajo de agricultura de 15 años,  ya que una actividad que aprendió de su padre quien con mucho orgullo trabajaba y cultivaba la tierra, en la actividad de granja de gallinas ponedoras tiene una experiencia de 2 años, ya que ha recibido un curso de formación en el cuido y manejo de aves a esta se suma la actividad que realiza todos los fines de semana como lo es el destazo de cerdos,  la cual se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos ya que tiene 6 meses de haber comenzado con esta actividad la que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos.


El dinero será utilizado en el mejoramiento de la granja, ya que las aves que tiene en existencia ya han cumplido la edad adecuada y ya no le es funcional continuar con las mismas, así que necesita comprar nuevas aves para que continúen produciendo huevos, también otra parte será invertido en el mejoramiento de las instalaciones para el destazo de cerdos. De esta forma mejoran sus ingresos económicos y así la calidad de vida de su familia. 


Las proyecciones que tiene para un futuro son las de tener un vehículo, el cual le sirva para viajar y mover su negocio ya que tiene proyectado construir una nueva galera para la crianza de cerdos en la cual tendrá que viajar al pueblo para comprar concentrado para cerdos y aves, también reconstruir su casa ya que en la que actualmente vive con su familia es de tierra y con la buena inversión de las ganancias y el buen manejo de un nuevo crédito podar construir su casa y que reúna todas las condiciones para vivir.
texts.en:
Josué is very educated person who has excellent principles.  He earns his living in farming.  He learned the trade from his father, who showed him the path to being a good person in life.  He is 24 years old. 

He used to live with his father, whom he helped with his work every day in the mornings, since in the afternoons he attended school, where he completed the seventh grade.  At that point his father was already elderly, and his health began to decline.  When his father died, Josué took the reins of his household, and he worked very hard to bring daily sustenance to his family, which is made up of his mother and his three sisters.

Since then, the young man has worked in agriculture, managing egg-laying hens as well as butchering pigs.  His mother and sisters also are involved in this work, and his sisters are currently studying at the school in the community.

Josué has 15 years of farming experience, since it is an activity which he learned from his father, who worked the land with a great deal of pride.  He has two years of experience managing egg-laying hens, since he took a basic course in the care and management of birds.  On top of this, every weekend he butchers pigs.  He started this six months ago, and it has become his main source of income.

He will use the funds to improve his operations.  The birds that he currently has have reached an age where it is not practical to continue with them.  Thus he needs to purchase new birds that will continue to produce eggs.   He will invest part of the money in improving his area for butchering pigs. In this way he will improve his income and therefore his family's quality of life.

In the future he plans to have a vehicle, so that he can travel and move his business.  He has plans to build a new shelter for raising pigs, which will require him to travel to the village to purchase feed for his pigs and birds.  He also plans to rebuild his home, since the one in which he currently lives with his family is built of mud.  With good investment of his profits and good management of a new loan, he will be able to build a new home and provide all the conditions needed for a better life.

loans.use: to purchase new birds to produce eggs.  He will also make improvements to his area for butchering pigs.

loans.name: Alba Patricia

texts.es:
Alba es una de las tantas mujeres de gran empuje y empeño que se dedican a la producción de flores para mercados internacionales.
Ella ha tenido buena trayectoria en este campo y ha recogido muy buenos éxitos producto de su esfuerzo y dedicación.
Actualmente posee tres cultivos de flores y genera alrededor de 15 empleos, contribuyendo así a la economía familiar.
Ella solicita un amparo económico para adquirir insumos de agricultura como fertilizantes y riegos, elementos que le permitirán realizar el correcto mantenimiento a sus cultivos garantizando así una buena calidad de producto.
Ella sueña con poder sacar adelante a sus dos hijos de 15 y 16 años, ofreciéndoles una excelente estabilidad económica y muy buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alba is one of the highly-driven and diligent women who make a living producing flowers for international markets.  She has had a good career path in this field and has achieved a lot of success as a result of her effort and dedication.  Currently she has three different types of flowers and approximately 15 employees, and thus contributes to the local economy.

She is seeking financial support to acquire farming supplies such as fertilizer and water, things which will enable her to take care of her crops properly and guarantee a high-quality product.

She dreams of providing a better life for her two children aged 15 and 16, and to offer them excellent financial stability and a very good quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Zhenishkul

texts.ru: Женишкуль 41 год, замужем. Есть 4 детей школьного возраста. У Женишкуль средне-специальное образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей и коллег. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Женишкуль в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2005 года занимается торговлей продуктами питания, начав этот бизнес с 25,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Женишкуль, она смогла развить свою деятельность и расширить товарооборот, на сегодняшний день ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 30,000 сом (KGS), что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от бизнеса позволили Женишкуль расширить свой товарооборот. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Женишкуль обратилась в  Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку продовольственных товаров для дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Женишкуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, а также в будущем хочет увеличить площадь своего торгового магазина.
texts.en: Zhenishkul is 41 years old and married. She has four young children. Zhenishkul has a secondary-specialized education. She has a good reputation amongst her neighbors and colleagues. The describe her as a kind and hardworking woman. As the main source of income for her family, Zhenishkul sells groceries. She started this business in 2005 with 25,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zhenishkul's hard work, she has been able to develop her business and expand her sales turnover. Currently, her monthly income is around 30,000 som (KGS), which primarily serves to cover her family's food expenses and daily living needs. The earnings from the business have allowed Zhenishkul to expand her sales turnover. For the purpose of further developing her business, Zhenishkul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 100,000 som (KGS) to buy groceries for future retail sale. Zhenishkul plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her business. She also wants to increase the size of her grocery store in the future.

loans.use: to buy groceries for future retail sale.

loans.name: Minavarkan

texts.ru: Минаваркан 48 лет. Совместно с супругом растят 6 детей. В 2004 году, Минаваркан начала бизнес в торговле рисом на местном рынке, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 10,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Минаваркан имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Минаваркан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) для покупки риса с целью дальнейшей его реализации. Доходы от кредита Минаваркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса и улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Minavarkan is 48 years old. Together with her husband, she is raising 6 children. In 2004, Minavarkan began a business selling rice at the local market. She started her business with initial start-up capital in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Having been able to develop her business and attract loyal customers, Minavarkan now has an average monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of the further enlargement and expansion of her business, Minavarkan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 40,000 som (KGS) to buy rice for future resale. Minavarkan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her business and the improvement of her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice for future retail sale.

loans.name: Malelega

texts.en:
Malelega is a 24-year-old woman with one child.
 
She has a small garden where she grows taro, cabbage, cucumber, and banana that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Malelega needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, an axe, a spade, chemicals, and bush-knives. Malelega will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, an axe, a spade, chemicals, and bush-knives.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a 32-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas, and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than six years. 

Christina has requested a loan to buy bush knives, weed sprayer, chemicals, filings, and an axe. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Christina hopes to support her family living and save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, weed sprayer, chemicals, filings, and an axe.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 57 years old and married with 11 children. She has a small business, selling tin fish, powder, flour, sugar, salt, ice cream, ice pop, chicken legs, etc. 

She has requested a loan to buy tin fish, corned beef, laundry powder, laundry soaps, sugar, flour, salt, ice cream, ice pop, chicken, sausages, toilet papers, snacks, cigarettes, and soft drinks.

Julia will use her profits to help her family and her children's education, and to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy tin fish, corned beef, laundry powder, sugar, ice cream, sausages, toilet papers, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Sarath

texts.en:
Sarath (in photo), age 27, lives in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh city. She has been married since 2007 and has two young children.

Sarath stays at home and does house work. Main source of income is from her husband’s business. Her husband is a lathe operator. She currently stays with her mother and wants to live separately. Hence, she decides to apply for a loan to build her own house to stay.

loans.use: to build her own house to stay.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is 50 years old and married to Ruth. He is a very loving father and husband. He has been engaged in farming for ten years. He learned from her parents how to cultivate land. Nestor loves what he is doing, and from the money he earns from farming, he can get all the needs of his family. That's why he is asking a loan amounting PHP 15,000 to buy sacks of fertilizer and three bags of rice seeds.

In the future, Nestor hopes that he can give all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and three bags of rice seeds.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
This is Lucena, a 60-year-old widow. She is a very hardworking mother, even at her age, because she wants to save money for her children's future. Her children help her with her farming business. 

Lucena borrowed money to purchase pesticides, fertilizer and seeds to grow for her business. Lucena's only dream in her life is to see that her children's future is okay.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides, fertilizer and seeds to grow for her business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 51 years old and married with eight children, four of whom in school.

Lucy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

Lucy has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for three years and also earns an income from a general store.

Lucy aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

loans.name: Batma

texts.ru: Батма, 34 года, замужем, мать 3 детей школьного и дошкольного возраста. Живут одной большой дружной семьей. Сама Батма по характеру очень трудолювая, ответственная и целеустремленная. У Батмы - высшее педагогическое образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она с 2002 года занимается разведением и перепродажей скота. Благодаря упорному труду Батмы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 2 теленка и 1 лошадь. Батма реализует молоко и молочную продукцию, а также скот на местном рынке. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Батма обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 125,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Батма планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также в будущем намерена сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Batma is 34 years old, married and a mother to three young children. They live together in one, big, close-knit family. Batma is very hardworking, responsible and goal-driven by nature. Batma has a higher education in the field of teaching. As the main source of income for her family, she has been raising and reselling cattle since 2002. Thanks to Batma's hard work, she currently has 3 milk cows, 2 calves and 1 horse on her farm. Batma sells milk, dairy products, and cattle at the local market. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of the further development of her business, Batma turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 125,000 som (KGS) to buy bull calves to fatten up and then later resell at the market for a high price. Batma plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She is also determined to make repairs on her house in the future.

loans.use: to buy bull calves to fatten up and then later resell for a high price.

loans.name: Erkinbubu

texts.ru: Эркинбубу 62 года, разведена, мать 3 детей. Младший сын помогает по хозяйству. У Эркинбубу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она с 2004 года занимается животноводством, стартовав с покупки 2 овец на 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Эркинбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь и 25 овец. Ежедневно Эркинбубу реализует молоко и молочную продукцию местным жителям. Ежемесячный доход составляет 35,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Эркинбубу обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 125,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализуемого молока. Доходы от кредита Эркинбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также в будущем намерена сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Erkinbubu is 62 years old, divorced, and a mother to 3 children. Her youngest son helps her with her farm. Erkinbubu has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she practices livestock breeding. She started this business in 2004 with an purchase of 2 sheep for 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Erkinbubu's hard work, she currently has 3 milk cows, 1 horse and 25 sheep on her farm. Everyday, Erkinbubu sells milk and dairy products to local residents. Her monthly income is 35,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of the further development of her farm, Erkinbubu turned to Microfinance Bank 'Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 125,000 som (KGS) to buy milk cows to increase her milk sales. Erkinbubu plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also is determined to make repairs on her house in the future.

loans.use: to buy milk cows to increase her milk sales.

loans.name: Lusila

texts.en:
Lusila is 67 years old and married with nine children. 

She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, yams, cabbages, cucumbers, green peppers and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Lusila needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, taro root crops, fertilizer, chemicals, a wheelbarrow and a backpack sprayer.

She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. Lusila will use the profits from her sales to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, taro root crops, fertilizer, chemicals, a wheelbarrow and a backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Tofu

texts.en:
Tofu is a 34-year-old single woman with one child. She has a small garden where she grows pineapples, cucumbers and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this business for two years.

Tofu needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, knives, a spade and weed spray. 

She joined SPBD in 2014. Tofu will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, knives, a spade and weed spray.

loans.name: Marqueritte

texts.en:
Marqueritte is a 34-year-old woman who is married with three children. She runs a business selling food and local goods in her community. She has two years of experience in this business. 

Marqueritte has requested a loan to buy noodles, milk, sugar, tin fish, cigarettes, soft drinks, Vailima beer, ice cream, snacks, toilet papers, laundry soap, mosquito coils, and chicken. She plans to use her profits to save for family needs. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy noodles, milk, sugar, tin fish, cigarettes, soft drinks, Vailima beer, etc.

loans.name: Taumaoe

texts.en:
Taumaoe is 53 years old and married with three children.
 
She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, taros, yams, and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Taumaoe needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, vegetable seeds, a rake, a garden-fork, and a wheelbarrow.
 
She joined SPBD in 2013. Taumaoe will use the profits from her sales to improve her family's lifestyle, support her children's education, and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, vegetable seeds, a rake, a garden fork, and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Mburucuya Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mburucuya Poty, está en su segundo ciclo  dentro del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas ellas se han comprometido a  trabajar y a realizar actividades   para llegar a los objetivos en común que tienen dentro del  grupo. 
Lucia integra este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de asaditos que ella misma hace y que vende en forma ambulante. Ella es muy buena en lo que hace, y es por eso que le está yendo muy bien. Comenta que su sueño es poder tener un bar donde pueda ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos, y asi seguir creciendo para ayudar a su familia.
Hoy pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para seguir haciendo sus asaditos, como ser carne, condimentos, palitos de brochet, panificados, mandioca y demás, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group is called Mburucuya Poty. This is its second cycle in the Women’s Committee Program, where all have promised to work and perform different activities in order to reach their common goals.

Lucia is a member of this group. She prepares and sells roasted meat as a street vendor. She is very good at what she does, which is why she is doing so well. She says that her dream is to have a bar where she can offer her customers a wider variety of products and in this way continue to grow in order to help her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to continue with her business, such as meat, spices, skewers, bakery products and cassava. This will be of great help for her.

loans.use: to buy meat, spices, skewers, bakery products, cassava and other ingredients.

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es:
Las Rosas es un grupo nuevo, que tiene su mayor entusiasmo para poder trabajar y ayudar a sus familias con el trabajo y las capacitaciones que van a recibir. Una de ellas es  Selva, quien es vendedora ambulante de prendas de todo tipo.
Se define a sí misma como una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo que quiere luchar por poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Su sueño es tener un salón grande de ventas donde poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de prendas y detalles.
Pide este préstamo ya que se acerca la temporada de frio y quiere tener una mayor variedad de prendas que poder ofrecer a sus clientes, y que de esa forma siga creciendo el número de su clientela. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Las Rosas is a new group which is very excited about being able to work and help their families with the work and training they will receive.  

One of the members is Selva who works as a street vendor selling all kinds of clothing.  She defines herself as a hard working person, but mainly her determination is to help her family and loved ones.  Her dream is to have a large shop where she can offer her customers a better variety of clothing and accessories.

She is requesting this loan because the cold season is approaching and she wants to have a wider variety of clothing on hand for her customers.  This will allow her to continue increasing her customer base.  She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy winter clothing to sell.

loans.name: Tajy Poty Group

texts.es:
Tajy Poty  se encuentra en el 2do. Ciclo del programa de comités cuenta con 17 integrantes actualmente, es un grupo muy unido, donde todas se están ayudando para poder salir adelante por medio del trabajo en equipo.
Una de las historias dignas de destacar es el de la señora Leonida, ella se dedica a la venta de ambulante de comidas variadas por toda la zona, esta actividad la realiza con ayuda de su familia, por medio de su trabajo.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser carne, verduras, condimentos, y demás, y de esa forma poder luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Tajy Poty finds itself in its second committee program cycle, and now has 17 members. It is a very unified group, where everyone is helping everyone to get ahead through teamwork.

One of the dignified stories to highlight is that of Señora Leonida, She is a walking seller of varied foods throughout the area, and she performs this activity with help from her family, and through her hard work.

She asks this loan to buy several items to continue making her food, such as meat, vegetables, condiments, and more, and in this way continue fighting to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blankets, sheets, bedspreads, duvets, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Tekopora Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tekopora  está en su ciclo número quinto del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, por medio del esfuerzo en conjunto.
Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y por sobre todo muy emprendedoras, y una de ellas es Maria, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas, que ella misma hace y que luego sale a vender. Ella es una persona muy dedicada a su familia, por quienes lucha.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar carne, leche, panificados, arroz, aceite, harina, etc., con lo cual podrá seguir haciendo las comidas que hace y podrá seguir ayudando a sus seres queridos con los ingresos que esta teniendo.
texts.en:
The Tekopora group is in its fifth cycle in the women's committee program. All of them have set the main goal of their own growth through working together. 

They are very hardworking women and above all they are very enterprising. One of them is Maria. She works selling food that she makes herself and later goes out to sell. She is very dedicated to her family and fights for them. She is asking for this loan to buy meat, milk, baked goods, rice, oil, flour, etc. so that she can keep making her food and keep helping her loved ones with her income.

loans.use: to buy meat, milk, baked goods, rice, oil, flour, etc. to make food to sell.

loans.name: Sherry

texts.en:
Sherry is a 20-year-old single woman with no children. She has a small plantation and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years.

Sherry has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a spade, hose, wheelbarrow, vegetable seeds, weed spray and a pair of gloves.

She joined SPBD in 2014. With her profits, Sherry hopes to improve her business to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a spade, hose, wheelbarrow, vegetable seeds, weed spray and a pair of gloves.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, yuca, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to start selling shoes and women's handbags at her shop.

loans.name: Samba

texts.fr: Monsieur Samba est un promoteur qui évolue dans l'aviculture. Il est marié et père de famille qui a une expérience de plus de 5ans dans cette activité. Il sollicite ce montant pour acheter des poussins et de l'aliment pour renforcer son activité. Il est responsable et prie en charge tous les dépenses et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Il voudrait augmenter sa production et cela grâce à l'aide de l’institution. Il aimerait aussi augmenter ses revenus et diversifier ses activités
texts.en: Samba is an entrepreneur involved in poultry farming.  He is married and he has a family.  He has been working in this field for more than five years.  He is taking this loan to buy some young chickens and chicken feed in order to boost his business.  He is a responsible man who takes care of all the tuition fees of his children.  He would like to increase his production, and to do so, he relies on the help of the (microfinance) institution.  He would also like to increase his income and diversify his activities.

loans.use: to buy young chickens and chicken feed to boost his poultry farming business.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen del Rosario está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité, es un grupo nuevo que forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas a través de la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza podrán conocer la situación de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirtha quien al entrar al grupo se encontraba por debajo de la línea de la pobreza, pero ella a través de la venta de frutas y verduras, casa por casa está luchando por ayudar a su familia. Mirtha es una mujer muy admirable, que lucha por salir adelante y que quiere capacitarse.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para poder comprar por cajones de frutas y verduras, lo que le ayudará a poder concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Rosario group is in their first loan cycle with the program committee.  It is a new group that formed as part of the poverty elimination program, where all the members can understand their situation with a poverty elimination survey.  

One of the group members is Mirtha, who was below the poverty line when she joined the group, but through the sales of fruit and vegetables is fighting to help her family.  Mirtha is an admirable woman who fights to move forward and wants to get training.

She is requesting this loan to be able to purchase crates of fruits and vegetables, which will help her firm up her business plan, which will help her improve her profits.

loans.use: to purchase crates of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Adjo est une dame qui se bat au quotidien. Mariée  à un employé de banque, elle est mère d’un enfant de six ans. Adjo  travaille très dur pour épauler son conjoint. 

Elle dirige  tout son commerce à la maison et demande un prêt de 400000FCFA en vue d'acheter des  biscuits, des détergents et des divers…  . 

Comme perspective d’avenir, Adjo  souhaite économiser de l'argent pour développer son activité 
.Elle projette ouvrir une boutique de semi-grossiste. Le couple travaille  avec détermination afin  d'avoir un meilleur revenu pour offrir à leur progéniture une meilleure éducation.
texts.en:
Adjo is a woman who is struggling to make a living, on a daily basis.  She is married to a bank clerk and the mother of a six-year-old.  She works very hard to help her husband.  She manages her own business from home and is requesting a loan of 400,000 CFA francs to buy some cookies, detergents and other goods.

In the future, Adjo would like to save some money in order to develop her business.  She is planning to open a semi-wholesale shop.  Adjo and her husband work very hard in order to increase their income and to give a better education to their future children.

loans.use: to buy cookies and other goods.

loans.name: Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Luchadoras está en su ciclo número noveno del programa de comité de mujeres, todas ellas son reconocidas por ser trabajadoras y luchadoras.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Sra. Marcelina, quien comenta que es empleada doméstica, y que también se dedica a hacer y vender asaditos. Es una mujer que gracias al apoyo de sus seres queridos está saliendo adelante, ya que ellos lo inspiran a seguir trabajando para que de esa forma puedan salir adelante. Su sueño es tener un copetín para trabajar y seguir haciendo las comidas que vende.
Pide este préstamo para comprar carne, palitos de brochet, mandiocas y demás insumos para poder seguir con la venta de sus asaditos. Marcelina está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe, ya que a través de las capacitaciones podrá mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
The Luchadoras group is in its ninth cycle of the Women's Committee Program. All of the members are recognized as being hardworking and fighting people. 

One of the members of this group is Marcelina. She is a domestic employee who also makes and sells roasted food. Thanks to the support of her loved ones, she is moving ahead. They inspire her to continue working so that she can make progress by way of her work. Her dream is to have a small restaurant where she can work and continue making the food which she sells.

She has applied for this loan to buy meat, skewers, cassava, and other ingredients to continue making roasted food. Marcelina is very grateful for the opportunity she is receiving, as she will be able to improve her life through the training sessions.

loans.use: to buy meat, skewers, cassava, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Maria Mirtha

texts.es:
María Mirtha tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Morropon, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado, actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años, repartiendo el pescado por los restaurants de su distrito y pedidos de sus vecinos, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de pescados y un culer grande para mantener en buen estado su producto para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Mirtha is 51 años years old and lives with her husband and children in Morropon district located in the province of the same name, in the Piura Region, on the North Coast of Peru. The people here in this hot climate work in agriculture, commerce and raise livestock.

María sells fish, an activity she has done for two years. She distributes the fish to restaurants in her area and fills orders from neighbors. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 10,000 PEN to buy a variety of fish and a large cooler to maintain her product in good condition for her clients.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish and a large cooler to keep them fresh.

loans.name: Candy Faye

texts.en:
