Levaea has requested a loan to buy fabrics, color paint, brushes, paint rollers, stencils and elei carved board. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, color paint, brushes, paint rollers, stencils and elei carved board.

loans.name: Tuna

texts.en:
Tuna is a 52-year-old single woman with one child.
 
She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Tuna has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a crowbar, sprayers and gloves.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Tuna hopes to build a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a crowbar, sprayers and gloves.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin has been operating his own retail store for more than five years and he earns well from this. He always finds ways to sustain the business. 

To improve sales, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, Edwin hopes to improve the general living conditions of the his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Joselyn

texts.en:
Joselyn is from  Zamboanga Del Norte. A 54-year-old, Joselyn is single and has one child. She has been planting and harvesting  vegetables for sale. She also raises pigs for sale and she earns additional income from that.

She joined GDMPC and gained access to financial services and it has helped improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Recently, she took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer and seedlings. In the near future, she wants to have a better living  with her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Meet Charles, a farmer who hails from the Kisii area of South Nyanza, Kenya where he lives with his wife and five children. He has been doing farming for the past 14 years which has been generating income for him. His primary sources of income are milk, eggs, tea, and a variety of crops; he also has a retail business. His biggest challenge in farming is lack of a market, and very poor roads, especially during the rainy season.

Charles says that this Kiva loan will enable him to purchase a dairy cow which will produce more milk for his family’s use and also for selling to the locals which will bring in more income. He says that this income will improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bersalia

texts.es:
Bersalia, ha tenido un efecto positivo en su negocio con el uso de financiamientos, la facilidad de pago que le brinda la institución ha servido para que se decida por solicitar un nuevo crédito con el cual comprara una vaca, cerdos concentrados, fertilizantes, abono, semilla, fortalecerá el negocio.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a seguir invirtiendo en la agricultura, su cosecha fue abundante, ha logrado cubrir las necesidades de su familia, cumplir con la entrega a tiempo de sus producto a los clientes y cancelar la deuda.
texts.en: For Bersalia, the use of financing has had a positive economic effect in her business. The ease of repayment that the institution affords has helped her decide to request a new loan with which she will buy a cow, feed, fertilizers, compost, seeds, and strengthen her business. The previous loan helped her to continue investing in farming. Her harvest was abundant, and she has been able to cover her family expenses, complete her orders to clients on time, and cancel her debt.

loans.use: to buy a cow, feed, fertilizers, compost, and seeds.

loans.name: Khiet

texts.en: Khiet would like to take a further loan to buy food and ingredients to sell from her food stall. Khiet's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and ingredients to sell from her food stall.
